text:
I went to titlemax  for a title loan. Having 2 titles for my car I gave them both at their request and was told that they would give my titles back to me at the end of the loan.
Now that I ahve paid off the loan, titlemax is claiming they sent my titles certified mail and have no reciept or proof this. Now my titles are lost. Calling titlemax to find out what happened I have gotten no help no answer no call back. They simple told me its not their problem.

Although I walked in at closing time , I told them I would come back tomorrow, they didn't let me out the door even though it was time for them to leave . This really made me feel special as a customer . It must be a great honor to have great employees working for your company , which in turns speaks in great volume, that you must be a great company to work for . In closing , I will tell all my friends of the great service I received from title max . Thank you for helping me out in my time of need . I also met Sarah , who also gave me great service . If this world had more great people like you all, this world would have many more grateful people like me.

name: alex harber
text:
Wouldn't even recommend for an enemy to go here it's so bad.

NEVER GO TO THIS BANK.  I have never been treated so terribly, after withdrawing money from this bank using their ATM and paying the extra charge I went to ask politely if they could break one of the 20s I withdrew so I could have smaller bills.  The clerk literally chuckled and told me no.  After this she hung up the phone/video call.
Unless you want terrible customer service and a bank clerk to figuratively spit in your face don't go here.

ABSOULTEY terrible, their service is as efficient and helpful as a football bat.

name: Courtney Williams
text: Please consider other options for your banking needs. I had an issue with a bank teller at the drive-thru with depositing  money into a checking account. I received a  receipt back for less money than deposited. I went in to file a dispute and was told an audit would be performed. I went back just over a week after not hearing anything, an was told no fault was found. This will be my last visit at this location.

text: Hate I chose this bank ,drive through lines are incredibly slow, when I deposited money (cash)into my account ,the receipt showed that the money wouldn't be deposited till 3 days later although it was cash, called the bank and it took several hours to resolve,tellers not friendly and awfully slow..need updated atm's where cash can possibly be deposited to save time ,spent over 24 minutes in line to deposit cash.

name: Joy Watts
text:
I set up a post-dated payment for one of my monthly installments and these Jokers, probably because it was Black Friday or probably because of human error, decided to send that payment through three days early. This caused me to end up with NSF fees for the living expenses that I have come out monthly. I called to tell him about it in a voice mail and never heard from them until I was late the following month.
They didn't even have the decency to offer an apology when they called to ask for the payment. Shameful. People who are borrowing money obviously don't need a company who doesn't care when they make things harder. Accident or not. They need a company with morals.
I will be reporting it to the better business bureau and speaking to an attorney see if this company needs to be responsible for those fees. I don't understand how, with a "recorded confirmation", they can send the electronic payments through before the day that is authorized.

resp.text: Joy, thank you for bringing this matter to our attention.  We apologize that you had an unfavorable experience.   Please call us directly at 844-338-2080 so that we can investigate this matter further.

text: Customer service sucks

name: Nikki Rochelle
text:
Really unhappy with my service today. I came through the drive through and the woman at the window took my money, gave me my receipt, and said "bye". I was not finished with my transaction so I pushed the call button and she said "do you need something else?".
When I told her a needed a different receipt, she said I would have to wait and she started to cash a check for a guy who pulled up to the next window AFTER I had arrived. Not only was she rude she was not helpful. After the man with the check finished his transaction. The teller came back to me and told me I should just use the app because she is alone and doesn't have any assistance in the office today (but the app is not showing the money deposited). She told me to wait a minute she just had to help this next woman with her transaction and she could assist me. This woman was the car behind the man who cashed the check (so TWO people that arrived after I did). I moved to Alabama from out of state and BB&t Bank came highly recommended to me from a lot of people that I met. I am seriously considering finding a another bank with employees who take customer service seriously, and care about maintaining customer relationships.

name: Domingo Ayala
text: Everyone at this bank is nice until Megan just gave me an awkwardly stare without any explanation and I asked “ ..... What? “ And she didn’t say anything which was beyond weird and unprofessional. I have had never experienced that type of odd behavior. Everyone else is nice and professional.

name: Jessica Penningtom
text: I love everyone at this location and they love my husky always spoil him giving him dog treats at the drive thru Everytime I come through they are all sweet never any issues or problems.

name: Selenophile Xx
text:
I opened my acct at this branch. I am currently living out of state in Wisconsin where there are no BBTs. I was very concerned about having to close my acct.. so I call this branch to see what i needed to do, some lady (yarah I believe) told me there was nothing she could do to help me.. i couldn't do it over the phone/online.. I tell her my situation. And she showed no concern or effort to help me. She told me I HAD to go to a branch in person to close my acct.. or I will still be charged a $5 maintenance fee..she also told me I would be charged a $35 fee if there's no money in the acct,on top of the$5.. needless to say when I hung up the phone I was very stressed & displeased..
I call the BBT on hwy72 in Madison AL.. I didn't need to say much of anything, the lady I spoke to was MORE than happy to help. INFACT, she told me the complete opposite from what this pelham branch told me.. that she could close it over the phone, easy! I just need to take my money out..&, she would keep an eye on my acct for me. THAT'S good customer service!

name: Chase Deppen
text: If you are a business owner and you deposit more $5525.00, they will not honor your deposit or give you access to those funds for 10 days.  Upon opening my business account, I wrote a personal check from my personal account to help fund my business account.  The next day, I called my bank to make sure that they had sent the funds to BB&T.  My bank told me that BB&T had received the funds the next business day.  However, BB&T told me that while they had the funds from my personal account, my business account wouldn't be able to access those funds for over a week.  Initially, they claimed that this happened only because it was a new account.  However, when I made a second deposit and the same thing happened-- immediate access to $200 and the rest of the deposit would maybe be available in 7-10 days-- they then pointed me to the account agreement where it said that all deposits over $5525.00 would have a holding period of 7-10 days.  I totally understand that is their policy, I just want to warn any business owner that this bank is not interested in deposits and will treat you terribly when you question the policy.

text: Automotive loan sharks with high interest rates. Repoed my sister's car just for changing her insurance to a cheaper company.

resp.text: Feel Free to call me. I feel you have been misinformed, we do NOT repo for this reason!  Only if Insurance is dropped or they may have changed insurance and didn't tell us. We call, and send letters and emails to customers before we ever repo for any reason. We don't ever want the vehicle back., so we do everything in our power to get in touch with the customer but we can only do so much. Communication is so important. We even send text messages to cell phones if allowed.

name: Jessica White
text: Worst experience EVER!!! Used this finance company to buy a car. We have automatic payments set up, and pay OVER the amount due everytime. When we tried to buy our first home we found out they had TWO accounts listed on our credit instead of one. This was in May.T us almost 3 weeks to get them to send proof to our bank that it was indeed only one account we have with them. Then 2 months later in July I called to have them switch my payments from the 1st to the 12th so our mortgage and car payment didn't come out the same day. On the 13th the payment still wasn't pending so I called back and the whoever I spoke with informed me when they switched it they set it up to come out August 12th so we would not have a payment coming out in July because we had been paying over the whole time we have had the car. On July 16th the payment suddenly comes out, overdrafting our account and leaving us with no money to get groceries, gas, ECT. Then when I try to call 30mins before they close they didn't answer. I tried to call for 20mins straight. Finally get in touch with corporate only to find out the information I received on the 13th was all a lie. I will NEVER use this place again and wouldn't refer them to my dog. The manager named Anthony is the ONLY person that I've ever spoken with that was respectful and helpful!!! Thank you Anthony they need more of you there.

name: Crystal Parker
text: When you come to get your car serviced, ask for Devon or Jeremy. They were the friendliest and most helpful when I brought my vehicle to be serviced. I had just bought my vehicle and had many questions. They were knowledgeable and incredibly patient when they answered them.

resp.text: Crystal, thank you for the kind words. We love hearing that our customers are happy with their experience at Bentley Cadillac! We appreciate your business and value you as a customer.

name: Valerie Stafford
text: I love Devon in the service department. She is focused on making sure the customer is greatly taken care of.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review, Valerie!  Please don’t hesitate to let us know when we can help in the future.  We value your business!

name: Damien Williams
text:
Checked my dash cam and the almost 4 hours I was at the dealership explained everything I needed to know. Car didn't get worked on until 2 hours into my wait. Had to wait 20 minutes after requesting an update after a couple hours of waiting. Not even a sorry for the wait or a discount.

Update: Talked to Alex over the phone and his apology seemed genuine and sincere. He went above and beyond to make it right.

resp.text: Very sorry for your experience. Your wait time was much longer than anticipated, so we are refunding you the alignment charges. We appreciate your business very much!

name: Austin Park
text: Aggressive pricing! One day I'll be able to afford a Cadillac, but I've consistently heard positive testimonies about them from people I've met who have bought a Cadillac there.

resp.text: Hello, we set high expectations for ourselves so it’s gratifying to hear you had a great experience with us. We do hope we can be of assistance in the future. Take care!

name: Susanne Pugh
text: I'm a transplant from Florida, so finding a Cadillac dealership in The Shoals area, with excellent service, is very important to me. Well I found that in Bentley Cadillac! My service advisor, Russell, was kind, courteous and very knowledgeable on the type of service my CTS would need, and making friends was an added bonus. Thank you!

resp.text: Thanks! We always want to hear back from our clients and we're glad you had such a positive experience with us! If you have any further questions, please give us a call. We're always happy to help!

text: I am always pleased the way I am treated in the service department. Everyone is friendly and speaks in a kind voice. Devon is busy but is generally interested in me and how I am doing. I love how she takes care of me and my Cadillac. This service department is one of the best. Thanks for the team work!

resp.text: Doris, thank you for the review and the kind words. We will pass your praise along to Devon. We value your business.

text:

resp.text: Thank you so much for the review!  Please don’t hesitate to let us know when we can help in the future.  We value your business!

He went over everything at the delivery and made sure I was comfortable with all the features before I left. Overall exceptional expierence with Bobby and the entire Bentley Cadillac dealership.

resp.text: Hi, your wonderful feedback and rating mean a lot to us. Until the next time we meet, take care!

She also sent me lots of extra pictures since we were looking for some very specific features. She even did quite a bit of preliminary leg work on letting us know if a trade was possible (it was, and very fair, in our opinion).

Once we finally made it out she made the entire process smooth, quick, and super easy.  She even cheerfully stayed late as we couldn't make it out until close to closing time. She was beyond polite and helpful throughout the entire process.  We couldn't recommend her or Young Motors more highly!

name: David Jones
text:
I was pleasantly surprised how easy the process was.  After entering basic information on the company's website I got a call from them! They connected me to the local office and I spoke to the manager, Rod, about the process. He told me to make sure I had a "clean" title and my ID with me--I also made sure I had proof of insurance and the registration with me (which he had not requested but he did need when we were processing the pawn. He also made sure I knew where the office was (which was a good thing because I had them confused with another place in town).

I went in to the office and the whole process took about 90 minutes from the time I walked in until I had a check. I was disappointed at the amount I was offered but my car is a 2006 model and is not in the best condition so could not really argue, particularly since I REALLY needed the money right away. Rod explained everything very carefully so I would know EXACTLY what I was getting myself into and I truly appreciate that since this is the first time I have pawned a car title.

I would recommend them highly.

name: Patricia Seymour
text: Love Gulf Coast Auto Group staff.  It’s the Audi that’s the problem.  I only have approximately 46K miles on the car.  She’s pretty.  But the convertible top has leaked since the purchase.  Then there have been so many problems with other parts, and a 3x AC problem/fix (qualifying it as a lemon), that it has been in the shop as much as it’s been with me.  I have a color-coded chart. When I let the “powers that be” at Audi know about the first few years of problems, they basically said, “FU with a smile”.  This car was actually built in Germany.  My German friends would be appalled.  They take their car quality very seriously.

name: Emily
text: I had a great experience purchasing my new car from Gulf Coast Auto Group. I highly recommend Mr. Kenny Cunningham. He was professional, honest, friendly, and made my buying experience easy and fast. All of the staff I spoke with were friendly and professional. I will use them in the future.

name: Ellie M
text: My service representative, Laura Collier, is wonderful! She always ensures that every issue is resolved. We have been extremely satisfied with the service that she and the mechanics at Audi of Mobile have provided to us over the past 5 years with our two Audis. My son took his Audi to another local repair shop and they caused damage to the vehicle because they lacked the knowledge and skills to properly perform the repairs. We then took his car to Audi of Mobile and they corrected everything! I will ONLY have my Audi Q5 serviced at Audi of Mobile.

name: Makenzie Brenner
text: I admit I was nervous to purchase a car online from a dealership over 6 hours away, but Gulf Coast Auto, specifically Devon made the experience seamless. Great communication, fantastic customer service and product knowledge. It was honestly the best experience I could’ve hoped for. 100% worth the road trip down and I am obsessed with my new car!

name: Queen Royalty
text: Everyone there is so nice and helpful. The finance department and the sales person (Alfredo Montes) made sure we understood the offer for our Volkswagen Atlas.

name: Myra C.
text: I went to Porsche of New Orleans and they were trying to blantantly make the 2018 Macan I wanted inaccessible. These fools really tried to make me put down 20,000 for a 500/month car payment. AVOID THAT DEALERSHIP AT ALL COST. They did not want to sell to a African American woman. Anyways, I found 2 more 2018 Macans in the Mobile area the same evening so we decided to go the next day. BEST DECISION EVER! I traded in my 2014 Infiniti Q60S that I loved dearly for a 2018 Porsche Macan! As a traveling CVOR tech, I needed more space and Kendarrius ensured that I didn’t leave without the vehicle that I wanted! I literally pulled up at 12:15 and was driving off at 4:30!! That was crazy fast, but if you are looking for an amazing deal on a beautiful car, THIS is the place to go. My monthly payment is 585/month on a PORSCHE!! That’s unheard of! They knew I wanted the car and this dealership made sure I left in it without having to eat bread and water for the next couple of years!

name: Monica Mingo
text:
My last two vehicles were Land Rovers.  I narrowed this purchase to an Audi or a Land Rover.  Devon took me on my test drives after donning a mask and I left with total knowledge of the Q5.  I went to the Land Rover dealership and was left knowing the same about their vehicles as I already knew upon arrival.  I was also unhappy with the attitude once I requested the salesman wear a mask during the test drive.

I called Devon the next morning to let him know that my husband and I would be returning and, when we got there, Devon was ready to go.  This young man has received several awards and accolades based on his performance and knowledge of Audi vehicles. I noticed two certifications on his desk.

Headed there my husband told me we were not going to buy the vehicle today and that this was simply an exploratory mission and that he wanted to test drive and then get the information in order to make a thoughtful decision.  After speaking with Devon at length, we ended up buying the Q5 same day.

Devon simply makes you feel good.  You sense his honesty right up front and there were no questions he couldn't answer.  We truly felt we were in extremely competant hands.

Thank you to Devon, the auto group, and for making it easy to jump the Land Rover ship and become a member of the Audi family.

name: Keri Van Atta
text: Alfredo Montes was very helpful and nice. We ended up not being able to afford the car we wanted, but he never made us feel bad or embarrassed. And most importantly he didn't make us feel like we wasted his time. He went above and beyond for us and I really appreciate it! Thanks Alfredo!!😊😊😊

name: Lee Lee
text: Courtney was so accommodating & super nice. Thanks Courtney- appreciate!

name: Daniel Flores
text: Purchased a VW all over the phone with Doug Klezmer. Doug took great care of me with a very smooth and convenient purchase. Very happy all the way around. Wish all car purchases were this easy! Thanks, Doug!

name: Michele
text: Me and my husband have had so many bad experiences here before the name change and new management or whatever. We always made appointments and would be there for 3 or 4 hours, we hated going there and the customer service was horrible! Today was the first time we've been there in at least a year or more and we were amazed at how much more better it is now. Our appointment was at 1 and we were out in less than an hour. Sean took great care of us and kept updated about what was going on with our car! The customer service was AMAZING! We have never experienced such great service like we did today. Thank you so much Laura and Sean and everyone for such a great experience and service we received today from you all!

name: Wayne Douglas
text: This dealership is very deceptive and dishonest. My salesperson was Alfredo. I specifically asked them to run my credit only through VW and stated that on the credit application. I found out a few days later that they had run it through all 3 credit bureaus instead and when I confronted Alfredo about it he said that that is just the way they do business and that my credit won't be hurt if I buy a car from them. My credit score dropped 24 points because of their unethical sales tactics. Most car manufacturers have their on inhouse financial arm so when you run your credit directly through them you only take an 8 point hit so that's why I made the specific request. Because I value my credit score so much it is very high and now I am reluctant to have it run at another dealership to get the car I want because of Alfredo and his companies dishonesty. This is just the worst fo many misleading statements Alfredo made to me. You're better off driving to one of the surrounding cities to buy your next vehicle than from here.

name: Krista Blanton-Goguen
text:
We recently bought our first Volvo. AJ has gone out of his way to make this experience as seamless as possible. His knowledge about the car far surpasses any other dealership we have worked with.
The vehicle is amazing and capable of so many things.  Each time the technology out smarts me he is always available to answer my text or phone call and walk me through it.
I just appreciate the extra effort he always goes to to make us feel valuable. I love my Volvo and don’t plan on going anywhere else for my future vehicles.

name: Robert Sanders
text: Had a wonderful experience from my first contact to walking out the door. Zach was great and took care of my wife and I. Recommended this place to everyone since buying a car and will go back for our next vehicle.

name: Patrick Isbell
text: My wife recently purchased a used 16 Beatle convertible that was a recent lease turn in. Devon was an awesome salesman and made us feel like family during the entire experience. I believe we got a quality vehicle and a reasonable price. I know she will be thinking of her buying experience and the welcoming employees whenever she drops the top this summer!

name: Edward Thomas
text: Gulf Coast Auto Group should change their name again, because of one simple question- do you give military discounts? No one in the service department knew or was unwilling to give at least 10% off. The parts department gave 10% off for military when I purchased 4 spark plug not less than 15 minutes laters. Military service people active and retired I will inform you don't buy anything from there without a discount 10% or higher, & at this point it should be higher.

name: june newton
text:
THIS THE PLACE!!
Considering a new car, this is the place! My husband and I bought 12 cars in our lifetime - this experience was by far the most professional/personable buying experience. The consultant, Santwan, was knowledgeable beyond measure, unlike the run-of-the-mil hunting salesman. The entire experience, from consultant, to floor manager [John], to Finance [Danny], to the GM [Mark].  Wow, treatment like the customer is a REAL PERSON not just a customer buying one of their cars - really, they have hearts and personality? We couldn't believe the care and the detail in service.  You go Gulf Coast Auto Group!!

resp.text:
Hi Ms. Newton, thank you so much for the kind words! We are thrilled that Santwan, John, Danny and Marc are an integral part of our team. We are so humbled that you chose Gulf Coast Auto Group!

Ashley Allen
Business Development Director

name: Elizabeth Millette
text: I recommmed this dealership to anyone. They made the car buying process easy! We first contacted Melissa from their online sales department. She was always quick to respond and answer our questions about a specific car, but never pushy or bothersome. When we were ready, she set us up an appointment to come in to the dealership. From that point we worked with Brittany Smith! She was a pleasure to do business with. Brittany was very friendly, knowledgeable and never made us feel rushed or pressured. We couldn’t be happier with our new car and the service we received at Gulf Coast Auto Group.

resp.text:
Hi Elizabeth, we are so happy you’re loving your new vehicle! Brittany and Melissa are key members to our sales team, and we are lucky to have them! I’ll pass your kind words on to them and our management staff Monday morning! Thanks again for giving us the opportunity to earn your business and we look forward to serving you!

Ashley D. Allen
Business Development Director

name: Anthony Cook
text:
I leased a 2018 Volkswagen Jetta from this dealership on June the 27th. It is now August  6th and I have yet to get my tag paperwork. I had to call the bank to get my old car loan extended so my old car loan would not go in collections. Not only that shortly after I leased I noticed a small ding on my hood. I went to the dealership to see what they could do and they said it would be no problem to fix. It has now been over a month I haven't received a call or a text. I know the dealership has recently changed owners, but the management at this establishment really dropped the ball. My family will no longer purchase or lease any vehicles from this dealership.

I did try to call you. I left a message and no response. Why would I have expected anything different.

resp.text: Anthony- I sincerely apologize for this inconvenience. We expect exceptional customer service, and we regret that we missed that mark. My name is Ashley Allen and I am the Business Development Director here at Gulf Coast Auto Group. Please call me directly at 251.301.0013 so we can get you what you need asap.

text:
Very poor customer service. I had a business checking account. On separate occasions, the tellers didn’t have enough cash on hand so I had to take a check from their bank to another to get enough cash for what I needed out of my checking account. Tellers made it cumbersome and difficult for my employees to cash their payroll checks (a BB&T check with ID at their branch).  When another bank I use made it easy for them to cash their (BB&T, a competitor’s) checks I wrote them from my BB&T account, I moved my account elsewhere. I can understand why they had to close their Dothan branch.

Their online banking was easy to use and robust but the local service couldn’t be much worse.

I even have an online account for the car loan...if they were so worried about security etc wouldn't they send the info i need via their online app?  Guess not...rather be difficult than helpful.  Thats ok though... i see how they gonna be.

text: I applied for a loan (big mistake). It was funded and I received an email saying they would send loan papers in a separate email. It never happened. Now I am in collections with no response from them at all. I am on disability and have medication I need. My bank account was in the negative and I had no money for medication. I explained this to them and still, no response. I will never give any banking information to anyone ever again, and I certainly will not take out a payday loan. This company is not reputable at all.

name: Stephanie Smith (Sunny)
text:
Do NOT ever use this company to get a title loan ESPECIALLY if you have a nice vehicle.    They will do everything they can to keep that vehicle If they know they can make a profit over the amount you owe and pocket the money.  I unfortunately had to use them while going thru a divorce and regret using them.    Not only did they claim I didnt make the first payment, but when I tried to pay it off, I was refused.    Thanks titlemax!!!!!!!!!
I would strongly suggest going to a credit union if you need a loan.   They have better options if you are in a bad situation.    There ARE other options !!!!!

name: David Collins
text:
These guy are Great!! Fast, Very Nice, & Great Customer Service!! I own my own business and I know Great Customer Service, trust me!!
So if you ever need a little cash to get some bills paid off, or even more, they can help you. They do more then just Title loans, I needed a little extra cash and they set us right away, about 15-30 minutes and it was done. The one in Andalusia, AL kicks butt , and I know about kicking butt, trust me. Thank you Cassie and guys. U. S. NAVY Vet Chief D. Collins
Global Power, get you some.

name: Jason Peterson
text: borrowed $2400 from this specific title loan company with payments of $425 a month.  I,then, learned that I needed a lung transplant so I refinanced the loan $316 a month for 25 months. I have already paid over $4500 for $2400 and now they want to settle for the same $2400 I first borrowed. These companies know people are in need and they feed on that. It should be illegal for them to charge that much interest. They could care less about your circumstances. To them the bottom line is the almighty $$$$$$$$$$$$$$.

name: Alec Hadley
text:
On September 10, 2020, my car broke down right outside Chatom AL. I sent my car that was under warranty to Chatom Ford. That was one of my worst mistakes possible. The first week of their service was promising. After that it was all down hill. Shade the “Service Manager” was my main point of contact. He would promise me updates and call backs which I would never get a returning call. On October 16th I was PROMISED my car was repaired and ready for pick up. As I had two friends take off work to take me 5.5 hours to Chatom Ford, Shade called me and said “the car jumped time and is not ready”. The following day I called to get the new date  I could expect my car to be repaired.  Shade then tells me that he had been lying to me and my car was not ready and he does not know why my car is not fixed nor when it could be fixed. During this call he also promised me that the car would be sent to my house in Tennessee. After Shade continued to lie about my car and repairing it, I then moved to speaking with Collin Ward (General Manager)-  I only spoke with him once because he told me “ I’m sure what you are saying MAY have happened, but im sure my team has a better way of going about this story”. He also promised I would get a call back from him and I never did. Collin also asked me why I would even send my car here with it being out of state and not send it local (I was on my way back from vacation on the coast when it happened). In my opinion, this should not matter. With no hope, I called asking for the owner, Gene Brown. No one would help me reach him. Then I finally received a call from Kevin O’Brien. He was very promising and reassuring at first as they all were. Kevin worked with my father and I for about two weeks then he stated to not take our calls or call us back as promised. Last, my father began to work with Lara. She was helpful in helping us know what was going on. She is who we worked with for the rest of this mayhem. 99 days later on December 18th Chatom Ford met me in Mississippi to give me my car. This dealership is an ACTUAL JOKE. From day one I asked for nothing but updates and I never once got that. NOT ONE WORKER AT THIS PLACE (I say place because I can not call this a business because this place has no business structure at all.) was truthful in customer service to my father or myself. If anyone at this place has any further questions feel free to contact me as you have my name and number. PLEASE SAVE YOUR MONEY AND TIME BY NOT SENDING YOUR CAR HERE. THIS MANAGEMENT IS A JOKE AND ABSOLUTELY WORTHLESS IN THEIR PROFESSION.
Thank you for the worst Ford experience I could ever ask for. You really make a name for yourself.

name: Kristen Tims
text: The “Titlemax Title Loans’” company here in Daphne Alabama are awesome.  They gave me no problems.  Hardly time consuming, and all that was asked of me was the common sense basic paperwork.  I came in with license, title, proof of residence (basic) paperwork and left with way more than I thought I’d get and hardly any interest was added on.  Wasn’t like the “nitemares” I’ve always heard about at all.  The manager Todd and Bob are awesome.  He made us feel at home, spoiling us with refreshment, (snacks and drinks) and keeping my kids , whom I just knew were going to act out, content with games and etc.. All around great place and for those whom question the title loan  “nitemare” it’s not what it’s made out to be.  It’s really helped me get my financial situation back on track and without some crazy payment or harrassing phone calls.

text: We had the worst experience ever. We had this salesman Stuart and he was rude and when we didn’t want to get the car he wanted us to get. He said, good day. He never tried to find us something around our price range and we sat there for 2 hours and he never was around us like he should as a salesman. So, we will NEVER go back there ever. After we left the sales manager called us and told us  he could find you a car, but we declined because y’all let money walk out the door. You can use good customer service towards your customers and it does help to be nice and smile. If you ever go there don’t talk to Stuart!!! The worst salesman ever and plus he was a fast talker which I didn’t like. Never again!!

text: Seem like good people but they should stop using the “backed by Burke” temporary tags. So many people running around town with that tag for much longer than a month. Needs an expiration date on it.

Justin,
Thank you for taking time to leave your feedback for us. We are concerned that we didn't meet your expectations. Please reach out to Cameron Jordan, General Manager, at (205) 324-3371 when you have the chance, so we can discuss your concerns. Take care.

text: Justin Gray was awesome

text: I had deep scratches in my BMW's bumper and they did an excellent job with removing the scratches and repainting. resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your great experience here at Jim Burke. Your kind words and positive review really mean a lot to us!

name: Stanley Triplett
text: I had the pleasure of working with Mr. Billy Kimble. Mr. Kimble was very knowledgeable and extremely helpful. Although Mr. Kimble and I went a few rounds in the negotiation process. I never felt pressured to purchase a vehicle. Jim Burke went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure the deal got done. In the end....I got the vehicle that I wanted. I have yet to complete my 1st oil change, however, after reading some of the reviews about the services department...I'm getting a little nervous. I'm sure Mr. Kimble with assist me with this is as well if necessary. I recommend anyone looking for a new or used vehicle to give Jim Burke a chance

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your positive experience with us! Customer satisfaction is our top priority and we are pleased to hear that Billy succeeded in that. Our service department will be happy to have you and will take the best possible care of your automotive needs. We truly value your feedback!

name: Neal R.
text: First time oil change for my car and I can not complain. It was free and I opted to wait. So for me to be there for a couple of hours is not an issue. What can u expect? Its free!! The service over all was good... No complaints... Glad I purchased my new vehicle from Jim Burke Dodge in Birmingham, AL 👍👍

name: Ryan Neilson
text:
Absolutely terrible dealership. BEWARE of these guys. They will say, do and will screw you any chance they get. Jim Burke Automotive was under investigation and found guilty of CRIMINAL CHARGES. Sounds like the perfect place to spend your money!

Don’t be a victim of the typical used car, huckster, unethical behavior exhibited by this dealership. Just go to another dealer and purchase your car there.

I’m in the process of starting litigation against them and of the 7 attorneys whom I’ve spoken to ALL of them know if this dealership and the terrible, unethical business practices exhibited by Jim Burke and its “Management”. Believe me if you have any problem or issue IT WILL NOT BE RESOLVED, it will be passed on and on to a inept GM who is the worst one. Make a smart decision and spend you hard earned money somewhere else. There is nothing like buying a $45k vehicle and they are backpedaling, lying and general shysters. BEWARE

resp.text: Jim Burke Automotive regrets when any incident of this magnitude occurs, and when customers respond by posting negative and untrue claims to social media. Due to the personal and private information of the customer involved, as a company, we have chosen not to release any details of the deal that took place and was agreed upon by both parties.

name: Pastor Randy Moore
text: Just went in for my free oil change but the process easy and convenient! I always get prompt and thoughtful service. The work is completed within the time period I was given and I get a courtesy phone call to let me know I can pick up my car. All I’ve had to do were oil changes and tire rotations on my 2015 Jeep Patriot High Altitudes and so far so good...

name: Harriette Pickens
text: Everything is smooth. They were very courteous and accommodating. I dropped my car off that morning and it was finished later that afternoon as promised. This is the second time I have had work done there and I was pleased on both occasions.

name: Cameron Day
text: Don that works in the body shop was referred to me by a close friend and he gave me the best service I have ever had in the automotive world. He went out of his way to perform extra work on my vehicle and he it wasn’t just work for him, he cared. Not only that, everything turned out exactly how I wanted it and looked flawless. Beyond that, it was done when he said it was going to be done. I have taken my vehicle many places before and it is always done the following week they say it will be done. This wasn’t the case here. Thank you Don and thank you Jim Burke for the awesome and new experience, I will recommend you to everyone and will be using you guys again!

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your great experience here at Jim Burke. Our body works hard to take the best care of our customers and we are happy to hear that they are doing just that! Thank you for your kind words and we appreciate your continued loyalty to Jim Burke!

name: Debbie Gray
text: Recently had some service work due to a recall on my previously owned Hyundai Santa Fe. My experience was exceptional. The service department was very professional. Provided an area for me to wait with comfortable wait space that provided free WiFi and refreshments. They also continuously offered shuttle service to the local area while I waited. The service was prompt and efficient. I will definitely return here next time my car needs servicing!

resp.text: We are extremely happy to hear of your awesome visit and we thank you so much for sharing your experience for others to see. Our service team works extremely hard to provide the best possible customer service and we're glad to hear that they are doing just that. We look forward to taking care of all of your future automotive needs!

text: Haven't been happy with this car buying experience at all. Had some flaws I pointed out to them in the beginning. The salesman said he would make an appointment so it would be fixed  I call now they dont want to be fix the car. The brakes are squealing the transm6souds horrible to pick up seed. I was sold a bad car.Rather it's used I shouldn't have these problems an have to pay good money for it. Thanks Jim Burke but never ever again. Bad experience

I am thoroughly enjoying my dream car, and wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Jim Burke dealership to family and friends.

to do business with... I sent my financial information

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing your great experience here at Jim Burke. Your kind words and positive review really mean a lot to us!

name: Cassella Scott
text: I believe Jim Burke doesn't care about customer service or customer appreciation because when you come in to the service department to get maintenance on your vehicle, the staff will avoid you like you had the plague when you approach them for help. It's like you almost have to stand in the middle of the floor and yell " CAN I GET SOME HELP IN HERE PLEASE!!!". Staff in the service department will just sit behind their little desks and won't even acknowledge that you are in there until you get right in their face and tell them you need service. Maybe they are trained to be that way because customer service is only as good as the people who manage and run the company. Dreadfully, when your vehicle goes to the back to be serviced, be prepared bring breakfast, lunch and dinner with you because you're stuck and at the mercy of Jim Burke service department. I had a staff member to tell me it will take about an hour and a half for an oil change and it turned to three and a half hours. I asked a staff member how long before my vehicle is finished in two hours. The staff member check and he told me it was still on the rack. At the last service appointment, my vehicle sat on the street when they finished with the doors unlocked for I don't know how long after service and I had to hunt down a staff member to get my keys. No one came to the waiting room to let me know my vehicle was ready. And that side of town in Birmingham has vehicles broken into all the time. So let me end this rant by saying there needs to be some checks and balances of the staff at Jim Burke service department because customer service is little to none there.

I am greatly disappointed, seeing this is the 3rd vehicle I have purchased from Jim Burke in 12 yrs. I don’t think I will be purchasing another from Jim Burke because of this. I love Jeeps but I’ll find one elsewhere next time( 4 years). Always pleasant experience for oil changes and service though.

name: Angelica Dill
text:
I just started leasing a Subaru Impreza sport about two months ago. I had a flat tire on a Friday afternoon so I called Jim Burke right away thinking they could help me. When I called, I asked them if they have the tire in stock and when they could get me in but the guy on the phone kept saying “I’m not sure”, “ I might have to order it” “maybe you could come in...”. I asked him if he could check his inventory because I really needed my car for work Monday. He told me to call back the next morning. I re-explained to him that I really needed to figure this out because I drive for work and needed my car situated by Monday.
I called Saturday morning - he said they didn’t have the tire in stock and they’d have to order it. Then he asked me repeatedly what tire I had and I told him multiple times what was written on the tire. He called back several more times to confirm what the tire was. Then he said he didn’t know when the tire would be in, maybe Tuesday or Wednesday.
I called Monday morning to see if they had any update on when the tire would come in but the service department didn’t answer. Then I called someone that I had been in contact with in the leasing department. They tried to get a hold of someone in service. By the end of the day the only thing they could tell me is that they didn’t know when the tire would be in because the guy who helped me Saturday was not in. I emphasized that I really needed my car for work and that I’d been driving on a spare. They said they’d  probably have a loaner car to give me on Tuesday but they’d have to get back with me in the morning.
Tuesday - I heard nothing all day. No updates about my tire. Heard nothing back about the loaner. Finally I called someone in the leasing department again around 3 and they said “no ones called you yet??”
By the time the guy finally got back with me he said he hasn’t been able to locate the loaner that it “disappeared”, he didn’t know why so many people were involved in this, and that the tire was still not in and he didn’t know when it would come.  I told him that I was frustrated and I needed either a tire or a loaner. He said if he would have known this Friday he would have given me a loaner............

Wednesday morning I was finally able to pick up a loaner car and then my tire came in and I picked up my car Thursday.

Not sure why I had to chase down this guy. He couldn’t tell me straight whether they carried the tire on the car that I leased from them. And his problem solving skills were just not there. The whole experience was frustrating and now I’m not looking forward to ever getting my car serviced there - especially if I have to work with this guy every time.

resp.text: We're extremely sorry to hear of the poor experience that you had with our service department. This is not typical behavior and this is not how we conduct business as a company. There is no reason that it should have taken that long for you to recieve any answers and we truly apologize for that. Please contact the service manager, Rusty, by calling 205-324-3371 and explain to him exactly what took place. We would love the opportunity to make things right and to earn back your trust in us!

name: Steffany Heacox
text: I brought my 2016 Jeep Patriot in for a wheel speed sensor. I had a 9:30 appointment. I arrived at 9 am with my 3 year old in tow. Simple right? At 11:30 they finally let me know it wasn't going to be warranty as we were out of the mileage range, which was incorrect, and was able to be corrected, and that the part was across town. Around 12:30 they come back in to let me know he was going to go get it from the Hoover dealer or it would be 3:30 or so before it was delivered. Here we sit at 3:30. FOR A SIMPLE WHEEL SPEED SENSOR!! THis waiting room is less than comfortable and with a three year old leaving and coming back with the escort service is not an option (car seat!?), there are no changing tables for diapers in ANY bathroom, no water in the cooler available even though I've asked 3 employees now, and no one has asked if the kid needs a snack! What if I hadn't packed any? Or didn't have cash for the very small selection in the vending machine? And the tv is stuck on old westerns. You can't change it. I've asked two employees sitting outside, both of which have said just a minute and never came in! Get it together Jim Burke. This is the WORST service we have ever gotten from a Jeep dealer. EVER. We will not be back at this rate.

resp.text: We would like to apologize for the type of service that you received and thank you for taking the time to inform us of your less than pleasant visit. There is no excuse for the lack of communication that you received as there are none to give. We do apologize for that and have addressed that directly with the staff along with the lack of assistance in getting water and TV changed. We have received feedback from other customers as well about changing stations in the bathrooms and we are working on that now to be more accommodating for all. We understand that it was a wheel speed sensor, which is a simple repair, that was delayed due to not having the part in stock. However, this should have and could have been communicated better in order to lessen the time that it took to go get the part or offer better options for you. We try and make each visit as comfortable and accommodating to each customer as much as possible and we obviously dropped the ball with your visit. We hope that you accept our sincerest apologies and trust the fact that we are addressing these issues so that you will give us another chance to earn your trust in the future.

text: Love Jim Burke Auto Body Shop. My car looked like it had never been in an accident. Mark (the guy who appraised my car) even saved me from getting a ticket. Highly Recommend.

name: Patience Loew
text:
Overall I believe that there are some good mechanics here; however they don't consider the overall customer experience. They are short handed so, you won't get a status of what's going on, the shuttle service ends at three and if your car is or isn't ready before then- no one calls you. When you call them, you aren't likely to get an answer or a call back. My car sit there for more than 24 hours ready, with nothing more to do to it, but because of miscommunication - I guess no one figured I needed a car within that time period. I don't know the thought processes behind this, no one figured I would need to make plans to get to and from work maybe that's why I couldn't get status on my vehicle.

I was guaranteed my issue was taken care of and I was told it was road tested for the shaking I was experiencing. text: There was one or two things that I was unsatisfied with. There was approximately 5 people and head of me all of those people what scene before me and that wasn't the problem when it got to me that was two people came in after me and they were seen as well before me I asked the gentleman had he heard anything about my car then he stated to me what the problem was and he was about to let me know what my problem was I let that go I went back to work he said he was going to call me when my car got ready but I had to call back down to Jim Burke someone else told me that my car was ready when I got back there then he initially told me that my car was ready I thought procedures were to call me to let me know that my car was ready if I had to call back I don't know if he had to call me or when he would have called me to let me know my car was ready I just didn't like that type of service but I got there to get my car he told me that I had they have fix the wire problem but the panel that the wire connect to might go bad so I may have the same problem over again I feel like if that was the case he should have told me that before I had that fixed if that was the problem I would have had the wiring and the harness fixed

resp.text: We apologize that you were left dissatisfied with your visit. As far as people coming in and out either ahead or after you it is difficult to comment as to why because we offer multiple services through multiple auto manufactures that have quick service options like Oil changes, filter replacements, etc. Your vehicle was in for an electrical diagnosis which can take more time. It appears that there was an issue with the wiring harness, which was repaired, also a possibility of another issue with the third brake light that would have resulted from the wiring harness short. When the third brake light was tested at the time of service it tested good, but had symptoms that could result in a possible failure in the future. However, we could not definitively say that it had failed and wouldn’t want to sell anything that is not needed. The estimate that was provided on your receipt was discounted to absorb the labor cost in the event it did fail at a later date keeping you from paying double labor. As far as contacting you when the vehicle was completed it is our practice to stay in constant contact as discussed with the customer and to contact once the vehicle is complete. We do not show the specifics as to when you were contacted but do have that the vehicle was completed around 12:00 p.m. If you were not contacted promptly or at all when the vehicle was completed we will address that directly with the advisor that assisted you. Again we apologize that you received less than an ideal service visit. We hope that you can give us the opportunity to make your future visits much better."

name: T A W A N A G O V E R
text: I was referred to Jim Burke Pre-Owned Supercenter by a very good friend, and she said I should ask for Terry Skinner. I made a visit on 01/09/17. I recently totaled a 2016 Nissan Altima SV, so getting another vehicle ASAP was of importance as I only had my rental car until 01/12/16. He did not waste my time. He asked what were my top 3 cars, my wants, what I didn't want, car note range and down payment amount. He ran with it from there.  He did above and beyond my expectations, and I will be a repeat customer of Terry Skinner and refer my friends and family. He was able to put me in a 2015 Nissan Altima 3.5 SL, and you wouldn't believe it if I told you how much I am saving monthly as my car not was almost cut in half. If you are in need of a respectable and honest saleman then Terry Skinner is your man! Visit him at Jim Burke Pre-Owned Supercenter you will not be disappointed!

name: tracy mccall
text:
My experience with the representative at Jim Burke Pre-Owned Super Center was phonominal. We are not newbies at Jim Burke.  Actually we vowed to never do business with them again due to an experience in the Nissan new car department we had in 2013.  The agent we initially dealt with was not thorough and didn't really seem to be interested in satisfying us, but instead wanted to just sell a car. My husband knew what he was looking for. The only reason we purchased the car was because it was exactly what I wanted.  Leading up to my retirement,  my husband,  Mike wanted to surprise me with my dream car which was an infinity Q50. Just so happened,  he observed the vehicle on the internet. Now from my understanding,  he wasn't looking to get it from them but more so wanted to see how the agents intentions for their customers' would be like. He made communication with Mr. JONTÉ WILLIAMS.  Well apparently Mr. Williams knows how to deal with hard rock minds like my husband.  Mike is a straight up business man who looks for people to hang themselves once he's had bad experiences with them but this was the case. Jonté was very professional but also displayed a great people oriented level of customer relation and appreciation.  Mike told me that Jonté was not pushy and that he was all about making sure I was happy with my retirement gift. When my husband told me what was going on, I did everything I could to make it known that I didn't want to go over there but when my husband said he was working with Jim Burke again,  I  knew it had to be ok. Well upon actually meeting Mr. Williams, I  observed him to be a very confident man in his spirit.  He is very comfortable with people such as my husband and when I saw them laughing and talking,  I  knew he, Mr. Williams, was trustworthy of giving our time and business to him. Jonté relating to me reminded me of a non paternal big brother I have. He kept me laughing but at the same time he took the time to make sure that I was comfortable with the decision to accept the infinity Q50. Donté really took care of us and put our mindset at ease when it came to purchasing future vehicles from Jim Burke. We would defiantly refer others to your business. Thank you Jonté for your professionalism,  and I look forward to seeing you again.

Tracy McCall and Michael McCall

name: Oneacia Lovely
text: The customer service was excellent and they definitely went above and beyond to get me a new car! I am so happy and I cannot thank you guys enough!

name: Stephanie Wilson
text: I had a great experience at Credit Now Auto Sales, I'll try not to make this too long because there are so many great points to make. My salesperson was Thad and when I arrived I was promptly greeted but no one was being pushy. They let me take my time to look it over, take pictures, make calls, and when I asked to test drive and take to my mechanic to look it over they encouraged I do that. I loved the vibe at the dealership, it was very lively and fun and eased my nerves.The manager was engaging and made sure we were taken care of and offered a lot of helpful advice. The lady in accounting thoroughly explained everything in a way that was easy to understand, and it was quick too! All I needed was proof of income, proof of address, drivers license, and a few references plus a down payment to get me going. Topping on the cake was they filled the tank up and included a 6,000 mile warranty at no extra charge! I'm a proud owner of an F250 pick up truck now!!!

name: Idealia Cleveland
text:
All of the bad reviews on this website are accurate. People write bad reviews for reason. I saw all of the great reviews here and I figured that this would be a decent place to purchase a vehicle for rebuilding credit. However, I was wrong. All of the bad reviews here are accurate. I've even waited 9 days to post this review because I didn't want to do it out of anger. I wanted to make sure that I am not in my emotions and being fair about what I am saying. I do not take any pleasure in writing this bad review.

I was strung along from this company for 18 days. I needed a vehicle because I had just come in town from across the country. These people claimed that I was going to put down $1200 for a 2006 Escalade. I never said that I was going to put down that much. I also have a call recorder app on my phone that records EVERY CALL. I went back and reviewed those calls and never in any of those audio's did I ever say that I was going to put down that much. As a matter of fact, I asked Jennifer specifically, "About how much are my payments going to be?" The only thing that was discussed was that it would be $175 every 2 weeks.

They went ahead "processed" My application. Jennifer came back and let me know that I was approved. However, the vehicle had several different issues that they needed to fix. Jennifer told me that it had to be put in the shop and that they didn't want me to have it in that condition. At the same time other customers, that had already purchased vehicles from this dealership, were bringing cars back because they were having issues with them. This was a major red flag for me. I kept getting put to the back burner because other people were bringing their cars back that they purchased from there, that needed to be fixed. I said that twice y'all. Think about that.

In the meantime, I didn't have a car and needed to get around. I asked Jennifer for a loaner, and she said they were "reluctant" to give me one because I'd be expecting that level of service all the time. But they wanted to get my business, so they provided me with an ugly Kia. It was ugly, but at least I could get to Walmart, ya know?

They finally got the Escalade fixed and ready by July 10th. Dave called me and let me know that it was ready. I drove the ugly Kia back to them. When I got there, I test drove the Escalade. I didn't like how bad the inside looked, but it's a 2006. There's obviously going to be a lot of wear and tear. Tracy asked me how much I was going to put down? I told her $500. She told me that Jennifer told her that we had already discussed the down payment. I told her no, she did not discuss that with me. The only thing that was discussed was the $175 every 2 weeks.

So of course they went and called Jennifer. And of course, they came back and told me that she said she discussed that with me. They would not be able to accept anything less than $1000. And then very callously, Tracy told Dave, "Take her home." I said, "Damn, y'all not even trying to work with me?" Nope. I didn't argue. I just gave them the key back and Dave drove me home apologizing.

I emailed them the audio proving what was said, and got crickets. They were caught in a lie.

Last week, I needed to get to the VA....I am a disabled veteran. It is important that if I need medical care, I have a way to get there so that I can receive what I need. I did not have a vehicle to get my medical care. I don't think these people even thought of how this was going to affect me. But something that I have learned is that if you are constantly being blocked for something, then spiritually, you are being blocked and protected for reason. And I think that I may have dodged a bullet with these people.

So everyone, please heed this warning. ALL of these bad reviews that are on here are here for a reason. I'm not bashing these people, I'm just stating the facts.

I hope that this never happens to any of them or their loved ones.

Patronize this business at your own risk.

text: I was in a tough situation with car trouble on my primary vehicle last month, and Monica helped me find a solution to get some equity out of my older vehicle to pay for a rental once my insurance stopped covering it. As a responsible adult who likes to believe "these kinds of things don't happen to me," Monica was a great help without judgement or fuss, just a solution that worked and kept me from losing my mind when everything seemed like it was doomed to fall apart. THANK YOU for your kindness and encouragement, it's nice to see a human touch in a business these days. Highly recommended!

name: Haley Norman
text: I wish you could give zero or negative stars to this place. Of course it's a title loan place, which already makes it terrible, but my grandchild was in the hospital and we needed the money quickly. First, they told me I had a minimum payment and if I paid early and extra, I would pay it off faster. Well, turns out that is a lie. You never pay it off. Also, I moved to another area and you can't pay it at another location, only at that location. I sent my husband to pay it for me from another city because I work late hours. They wouldn't even take a payment from him because he isn't on the account, what the heck!!!!! These people are stupid crooks! They call me 3 times a day every day and when I try to pay them they won't let me do it!! They are terrible; please find another way to get extra money quickly!

text: I went to title max in total depression ! I found out that my dog has cancer and I needed 4000 . dollars for emergency surgery ! I didn't know what to do ! Monica totally put my mind at ease about the money and about my dog ! She had me approved in no time and the money in my hand ! I have never had to pawn a title for any reason , but she made it so easy  ! I have to thank her for the compassion she showed me that day ! Thank you title max for having employees like her to make you feel comfortable with the situation of having to get a loan !

name: Arthur Lamounier Moura
text:
The staff was really helpful and attentive, and tried to solve my situation and provide me the information I needed. However, if you're an international student, they do not allow you to open the simplest account without having a Social Security Number with you. This is very odd, considering that all the other banks in town accept the regular immigrant documents, such as visa, I-20, passport, etc. Also, Auburn University is an institution that receives lots of International students for all over the world every semester and this Credit union did not think of a good solution for this type of customer...

Since I had to open an account in one way or another, I had to choose another bank, in my case Chase Bank... So be aware of that if you're an international student!

resp.text:
Mr. Moura,

AU Credit Union accepts one or more of the following documents for a non-U.S. person:
- Taxpayer Identification Number
- Passport Number and Country of Issuance
- Alien Identification Card Number
- Number and Country of Issuance of any other Government-Issued Document evidencing nationality or residence and bearing a photograph or similar safeguard

We sincerely apologize if one or more of the above mentioned documents were provided to us but denied at the time of your account opening. Please still consider AU Credit Union as a trusted financial institution in your local area, and contact memberservices@aufcu.org about reapplying for membership with one or more of the documents listed above.

resp.text: Scott - Very happy to hear how good your member experience has been. We will continue to strive every day to provide the same great local service! Thank your for your membership!

text: Amazing customer service and great people; never had one negative experience here.

resp.text: Thanks so much for taking the time to write this review. I'm thrilled to hear that you appreciate the great people we have on our team here at Auburn University Credit Union. We would like to express our appreciation for your membership and being a part of our financial family.

name: John Beede
text: One teller working, other employees sitting around spraying each other with lysol or sanitizer laughing.  Line of people waiting.  Finally one of the other workers Baye calls me up to cash a check.  She was completely incompetent and calls for help.  Other lady comes over and tells me they are going to have to put a 4 day hold on my check (under $300).  I told them no, close my account.  Other lady walks away and the teller is standing there staring off into space.  Other lady comes back, and she says yes he wants to close the account, (I had been standing there for 5 minutes.)  This place needs qualified people, not kids who like to play around.  And Baye, grow some brains.

resp.text: Hi John, thank you for your feedback. Please email memberservices@aufcu.org, so we can address this issue.

Good luck trying to get anything resolved at this credit union.

name: Brittney E
text: I took my Escalade to the service dept to get work done on it. They miss diagnosed it and I paid over $500.00 for repair. I had my truck 2 days before it started doing the same thing again. I called to let them know and got the vehicle back over to them. They had my truck a little over a week and claim it was not doing anything for them and that it was old codes showing up. Well since I have had my vehicle back it once again started doing the same thing showing up the same codes. I decided to take it to another dealership and to my surprise the codes that they told me was old was not old they just cleared them instead of fixing my truck. I'm very upset because they repeatedly lied to me over and over. I will not recommend the service dept at all. They just played around with my truck and I called to let Myla know that it was doing the same thing again and that I took it to another dealership and they showed me how codes had been cleared and showed me the history codes. She stated Christian the service manager would call me but he never did.

resp.text: Thank you for taking the time to leave us a review. I am very sorry your experience wasn’t what you’d hoped. I have reached out to management to let them know about your recent experience. Someone will be in contact soon.

Before leaving me with my new car, he explained again how to use the features in the car.  In closing, it is obvious that Rodney enjoys selling cars and making his customers happy.

text: I purchased a vehicle from this dealership in Jan 2021. I came from out of state to pick up the vehicle and when I arrived found out there was an issue with the vehicle. After waiting for a while we worked out  a fixed for the issues and the dealer said they would send a check to me for the repairs. It took almost two weeks for them to finally send the check to me.  Now over a month after I purchased the vehicle I get a message from my county tag office saying that the dealership didn't pay the Tag fe and I will have to come in and pay it.  If a dealer is not going to pay these fees, they need to let people know so your not waiting until the temporary tags run out.

name: Katy McGehee
text:
The service department is the best I've ever encountered. They have gone above and beyond every single time. I'm not a crying person but they've made me cry twice. The good cry. The first time: I assume they saw the toy factory and smashed snacks in the carpet or maybe it was my food covered shirt and crazy hair. Either way, they gave me a note of encouragement that every mom needs sometimes with a gift card for coffee. The second time: I requested a larger loaner vehicle which is apparently hard to come by. Along with my 3 kids, my dad is in a wheelchair and I transport him to/from dialysis and we just all wouldn't fit in the smaller one. They greeted me with a "one tough cookie" box with treats and snacks galore.

They are the nicest people and so accommodating. Add uplifting to that mix. That was this exhausted Mama's gift from heaven.

I can't say enough good things about them. I would buy every vehicle from them a thousand times over just to show my appreciation to their service department. Thanks guys!

name: Veronica Eaton
text: I was due for an oil change for my 2012 Cadillac SRX and received a call from the dealership asking me to schedule an appt. I looked online 1st to schedule, there was an appt. available for the next day. I didn't book it, thinking that maybe the person that called would get credit for service. I called her back, and was informed that it would be a week out for the oil change, fine. I also had a secondary issue of getting an estimate for the liftgate actuator replacement. A week later, I take the car in and wait on it. When it was done, I specifically asked about the actuator and was told that the estimate was the paperwork. It wasn't. I called back today to see when I could have this repaired and  was given another appt. a week out. The moral of the story is that they listed 12 things for "recommended services"  but nothing on what I actually requested. The car could have been repaired 10 days ago if I had been given the info that I requested. Now I'm trying to see if I can get my SRX repaired at another dealership either in Pensacola or Gulf Port.

resp.text: Hi Veronica,  I am very sorry to hear about your recent experiece with us. It is our goal to provide each customer with the best service experience possible. We have passed your feedback along to our General Manager and Serivice Manager. With your feedback we can only improve our processes and provide you with the best experience possible.

text: By far the absolute best experience I have ever had buying a car. If you are looking for a car please see Michael Sewell. Absolutely fantastic to deal with and I would highly recommend him! The transparency and honesty were a complete change from what I expected. I have an absolute new respect for the Bullard family and their dealerships. Once you walk in there is no doubt that customer satisfaction and the customers experience is higher in the business plan than the numbers are which is not normal operating procedure in most dealerships I could not write enough about how pleased I was with the whole experience. I did not walk out feeling as though a great deal on a vehicle was the only thing I got. I walked out of that dealership with an uplifted spirit and felt through the whole process that I was receiving amazing fellowship and as if I were being edified through this whole process. If God sees fit I will absolutely be a customer for life.They were an absolute inspiration and are a perfect model of a working business  plan that is extremely successful. And I’m not talking only monetarily successful. I left with a fire in me that they helped to burn brighter. And I thank them from the bottom of my heart for allowing God to work through them as they unknowingly ministered to me They never realized it and that’s what makes them special.

name: Douglas Allen
text: What started off as a beautiful experience has turned out to be a nightmare. I purchased what was told to me to be my Certified 2015 Chevrolet Suburban LTZ. Rodney Lofton who is a awesome salesman and Roseevelt Harris the phenomenal finance guy sold me the vehicle and 3mths into my purchased I was told I had over $2k worth of repairs including brakes, new radiator, tune-up, oil cooler lines, and left tie rod end just to name a few. When I asked why wasn't these things serviced and replaced before I purchased the vehicle I was told the repairs wasn't necessary at the time. I feel the salesman did a great job but the service department made it a bad purchase by not doing their job!! I had to pay for the replacement of the radiator and oil cooling lines but the other repairs are still needed. I feel robbed and will probably never purchase from a major dealership like Joe Bullard again!!

resp.text:
Hi Mr. Allen,

Thank you for taking the time to give us this feedback. To make sure this issue is addressed/resolved I have notified the General Manager, Jason Colbert, of the situation and asked that he reached out to you as soon as possible today.

I'm very sorry that your service experience did not mirror your sales experience at our store but I'm confident if there's a way to rectify the issue our team will do so.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M., Marketing Manager

name: Robert Werning
text:
Review of Joe Bullard dealership

My used car purchase was probably a little different than most.  In my case, I needed a good, reliable vehicle as quickly as possible and would immediately be making a 12 hour road trip to a different state as soon as the car was in my possession!  My salesman Curtis Williams showed me what I wanted to see, took the time to answer my questions, and gave me the time to decide if the car was right for me - no "pressure to buy" involved.

Curtis actually delivered the car personally the next day, so that I did not have make another 2 hour trip from Pensacola to Mobile and back to pick up the car!
Overall I would say that I am very satisfied with the service I received at this dealership.  If all their employees are as conscientious as the ones that I dealt with I would not hesitate to recommend this dealer.

text: Allen, my salesman was excellent. He treated me like we were best friends. Very polite and considerate and professional. He went way out of his way, even offered to deliver the car and paperwork to my office so it would not cut into my lunch time. I am 43, and I have never in my life dealt with such a wonderful member of any sales staff. He is the reason I will only purchase vehicles from this dealership. He has my business forever.

text:
We just got our XT4 and are very satisfied with it. Our salesman. Troy was very kind to answer our questions and made sure we understood how things worked.  We were in a time crunch and he assured us that we could come by, call, email or text if we had more questions.
Respect and kindness are almost a lost value in todays society, but to us they are still important, Troy exemplifies these and more in how he serves his customers,
We were  surprised to hear Christian music playing and to hear the testimonies of several of the staff. We thank them for their standing up for the American values and showing that they are truly a family doing business in an honorable way.
Troy, we have put you and your new Bride on our pray list and thank you for not making fun of us older folks that haven't embraced " this tech -infested" world  fully yet.
We will see you this coming week with more ? and to drop off the keys.

name: Willie Johnson
text:
I have purchase many vehicle and I must say that this was one of the most pleasant experiences I have encountered buying a vehicle.  From my internet inquiry I get a phone call from Ms. Ashley Allen, a very pleasant experience.  Ms. Allen set up an appointment for me to see the vehicle I was inquiring about with Mr. Ben Jackson.  From the moment I entered the doors I was greeted and treated as a lifelong customer.  After meeting with Mr. Jackson I was introduce to Mr. Curtis Williams who would be my salesman.

Mr. Williams and I sat down to discuss what I was looking for in the vehicle of my my choice.  Once I had selected the vehicle, Mr. Williams made the test drive a pleasant and unique experience.  After I decided that this was the vehicle that i wanted, he even saw to it that the reasonable minor imperfections that I nit-picked while looking over the vehicle were taken care of prior to my picking up the vehicle.  Negotiating the final price was even an enjoyable experience, which is rare.  I think that at the end of the day we were both happy with the price.  At no time during the experience did I feel pressured or uneasy.

I will highly recommend to anyone that is looking to purchase a new or used vehicle, visit Joe Bullock Cadillac and ask for Mr. Curtis Williams.

Willie Johnson

text: I am happy to write about my experience at Joe Bullard Cadillac.  As a first time Cadillac owner, I could not be more happy with my purchase as well as my sales consultant, Doug Klezmer.  The laid back no pressure to buy environment is what I love most.  My sales consultant was very knowledgeable on the Cadillac and all the great features it has to offer.  Because this car has a lot of advance technology, my sales consultant went over every single feature to ensure I know how it operates.  Additionally, he made himself available to me should I have questions or concerns once leaving the dealership or in the days to follow.   Without hesitation, I recommend this dealership and more importantly this sales consultant if you are in the market for a new vehicle.
