name: Matt Holloway
text: Terrible! I came in because I had a tail light out and it's one of the newer LED lights that aren't supposed to burn out. They told me to come in at 3 and I would be out by 4. At 4 they had just finished their diagnostic check and they told me it would cost $607 to replace my tail light. I told them to go ahead even though I believed it was too pricey. The rep told me the light costs $500+ and the labor wasnt that much. I started to look up the part online brand new and I could buy 2 for less than what he quoted me. I told him they could stop and I'll bring in the light myself after buying it cheaper elsewhere. He tells me I will still have to pay $135 for the diagnostic. No problem. He comes back and tells me it's already in. I ask well where is my car? He says they're finishing up. 45 minutes later he comes back and tells me that they put a new light in and it didnt work. Must be a wiring issue he said. So I said: "So that $135 diagnostic u tried to charge me for wasn't even accurate? Because the diagnostic claimed I needed a new light." He never did answer. They did change my oil so I paid for my oil change only and went to leave. When I got my car back if was filthy even though they claimed all customers get a complimentary wash with all services. I will never go there again.

resp.text:
Hi Matt,

Thank you for providing us with this valuable feedback. I assure you this is not the Bullard experience we want for our clients.

I have forwarded your comments to the Service Manager, Sean Alexander, as well as the General Manager so that this can be addressed. I’ve also asked for one of them
to contact you to personally discuss in more detail.

I’m sincerely sorry for how your visit with us needed and I hope that we will be able to earn back your business.

Kindest regards,
Kristina M.

name: Julie A
text:
Our family was on vacation in Mobile Alabama this past week. Things didn't go quite as we had planned. Our SUV was cutting out pretty bad on the highway. It was getting worse the closer we got to Mobile. I contacted my friend who's daughter lives in Mobile to see if she might know of a service place. I talked with her daughter and she informed me that her husband, Kyle, worked for Joe Bullard Cadillac. She gave me the number for the service department and said to speak with Haley.  About this time the check engine light came on in our vehicle. It was flashing on and off, then would stay lit.
When I spoke with Haley in the service department she asked about the service engine light. When I told her it had been flashing intermittently she was immediately concerned and said we should get stopped as quickly as we could to avoid internal engine damage.  She then helped us get started with finding a tow service. We were 50 miles aWay and had four people so their usual towing service couldn't do it, but she got the ball rolling for us. She gave me her direct phone number so I could call if I needed anything.
Once we got to the dealership Kyle helped us get a loaner car while ours was being repaired. Haley kept us informed as they learned what was wrong. Our technician, Mike, came in on Saturday to work on our vehicle because we needed to leave to head back to Missouri on Sunday.
To make a long story short...God used all of these people to help us during a difficult time. They made this experience so much less stressful than it could've been. THEY WENT ABOVE AND BEYOND TO HELP US! And, they did it all with a smile. We appreciate the dealership and all the individuals who helped get us back on the road. I would recommend them to anyone who needs service or a new ride!!!

resp.text:
Thank you for your wonderful feedback. We always strive to meet the needs of our customers no matter the situation. Feel free to let us know if you have any concerns about your vehicle.

Kind regards,
Robby Herbert, GM, rherbert@joebullard.com (251)-544-7341

name: Jami Morgan
text: The people in the service department handling my claim were very nice. What I didn't like was that the mechanics were excessively rough with my vehicle. I had to have it towed and the towing company left it at the gate. Christian got me a loaner car, which I appreciated very much. When I picked up the loaner there were 2 guys who were trying to get it started to get it up to the shop. I needed to grab a couple things out of my car so I stopped to do that. For some reason they needed to open the back hatch. I was traveling with my animals so I had a large kennel in the back. I watched them put my seats down (rather roughly) and sling my kennel from the back to atop the back seats. It made me cringe but at this point I needed to get going as I had some stops to make and  I thought surely they knew what they were doing, this is a Cadillac dealership afterall and these cars cost a lot. They will surely be careful... When I got my car back, instead of them putting the vehicle back they way they found it, the kennel was still strown across the back. (As a plus though, it was washed! Which I appreciated since I had been on the road and try to take care of my car!) When I went to move the kennel back in place I noticed that there are scrapes across the plastic sides in the back. Greeeeaaaaaat. But, at that point I was leaving to head back to my home state and couldn't worry about it. It was more important to get home safe. They told me in addition to the battery that I needed new air filters, a rear wiper blade, and the throttle body cleaned, all easy enough for me to do myself. So, now I am here doing said maintenance and when I popped the hood I immediately noticed that my positive battery terminal clip has been broken and won't stay shut. Great. I am now back home, 3 states away. I will be back to the area, and am considering moving my family there but if they don't make this right I will find a different dealership to maintenance at.

resp.text:
Hi Jami,

Thank you for taking the time to leave your review and detailed feedback. We are closed today; however, I’m sending your comments over to my General Manager and Service Manager to make sure they address this first thing in the morning. Please expect a call from us tomorrow. I’m very sorry for your experience and I hope we have the opportunity to prove to you this is not how do business nor is this how we want our customers to feel when they leave our dealership.

Sincerely,
Kristina M.
Marketing Manager

text: This was the best car shopping experience that I have ever had, if it was ten stars they would get it from me. She sent me to my saleslady Courtney Mauldin, asks for her when you come in, she was totally Awesome. She went above and beyond to get a deal worked out for me,  there was an issue with the car and she took it straight to  service and they fixed it right away and found something else and ordered the part and sent it to detail to get it clean up and they did a great job. If you are looking to purchase a vehicle I recommend Joe Bullard Cadillac, who will treat you right, quick in and out, and they are Veteran friendly, great staff and service. It was worth the 285 miles that I drove from Louisiana to get an awesome deal and meet some great people that really cared about my shopping experience. Ms. Courtney  called me on Monday to check on me to make sure everything was alright with me and the Escalade, and that is quality service at it fineness.

name: Bill McLarty
text: I am William, answering for my wife Cheryl.  We bought this car new in 2004.  It has been solely serviced and maintained by McConnel/Bullard.  It has less than 30,000 miles on the odometer.  It's been the worst car we've owned since our marriage in 1962.  The problem today was a broken window regulator on the rear driver's side.  My wife has been the sole driver of this car.  We have no children in then home.  My conservative guess is that this window has been lowered and raised no more than 10 times in its aborted lifetime.  My wife was told a plastic roller had broken.  A plastic roller in a $50,000 (2004) Cadillac?!  My bill:  $517.23!  I can go back through my invoices and find similar instances of shoddy work and padded bills.  During the second year we owned the car the driver side dash assembly fell off the dash while my wife was driving.  At around the 4-5 year of ownership your service supervisor convinced my wife that she needed to replace all four tires (around 10,000 miles) because they had "dry-rotted." ($800)  I've owned two Cadillac De Ville's prior to this, and have never experienced what has to be either poor construction, low-quality parts, or untruthful service managers.

text: Saw a vehicle being advertised on Autotrader website that I was interested in. Before I made my visit to the lot, my mind was set that I would only be going to look at the vehicle. All my questions and concerns was addressed with expertise and professionalism. Not once did I ever feel pressured. After a test drive and feeling this the vehicle I wanted, I told him I will be getting back with him. After conversing on and off for about a month with Moose the salesman by phone and having the privilege to speak directly to Ty (the owner of the dealership)  I felt the dealership really wanted my business and cared about my satisfaction.The deal was made by phone. Vehicle was delivered to my home personally by my salesman. All transactions and paperwork done in the comfort of my home. I was very impressed with the way I was treated during my recent buying experience at Joe Bullard Cadillac. Would definitely recommend family and friends.

text: Absolutely, the most wonderful buying experience my wife Kathy and I have ever had.  The atmosphere was amazing!! He knew 'everything' and treated us royally with the test driving and description of the many facets of the vehicle. Andrew kept everything in perspective of the price we could afford. Then he turned us over to Jon McCarthy who was equally as brilliant. Jon made it happen!!! What service!! Jon was so relatable with such tenacity in helping us, and he really came through with making our dream come true!! We highly recommend the family of Joe Bullard Cadillac, and especially Andrew Speight and Jon McCarthy.  They will indeed spoil you! We really thank the Lord for sending us to this Company, thy are a true blessing to the gulf coast!!

name: C C Hall
text: I purchased a Cadillac SRX on 1/11/14 from Joe Bullard Cadillac. Curtis, Roosevelt and Ty were very courteous to me and my husband. They answered all of my questions and worked with us to get to the price we were willing to pay. The Cadillac warranty is hard to beat, especially the 4 years of maintenance and the road side assistance. This is the 6th GM vehicle that we presently own and I know will be the best serviced one by far. I had been looking for a vehicle for 5 months when I decided to look at the SRX. I am glad I did. It has everything on it that I was looking for plus a lot or more features. Everyone at the dealership that walked by you spoke and asked you how you were doing. This is a dream vehicle for me and I look forward to driving it for years. I will recommend to family and friends that are interested in a great luxury car or SUV to get a Cadillac at Joe Bullard Cadillac in Mobile, Alabama and ask for Curtis. I had to use the service department today to get my oil changed and check the routine things out. Christian and the others were very courteous and took care of me and my SRX. The customer lounge area was very pleasant and comfortable during my wait.

name: Ashley Brown
text:
Superior Service A++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

My experience at Joe Bullard Cadillac - Mobile Alabama was excellent to say the least. The moment my fiance and I pulled up to the dealership we felt welcome. Mustafa Elastal immediately greeted us and made us feel important. He went out of his way to make us feel comfortable as he walked around the lot with us picking out suitable vehicles. This was very important to me considering I had never owned a Cadillac before. His extensive knowledge of the vehicle I wanted (XTS) and the history of Cadillac itself impressed me by far. The hospitality didn't stop with Mustafa. Roosevelt Harris also did a fine job answering all the questions I had about the different cars and prices. He also mentioned a couple of nice restaurants we could try out while visiting Atlanta, GA which we did and absolutely loved. Curtis Williams came by and personally greeted us and also had a nice conversation with my fiance. Last, but definitely not least, Jon McCartney was absolutely amazing (and not just because he actually knows where Winnfield, LA is located lol). He worked very hard to get the financing I needed to get the exact vehicle I wanted. It was a hard sale for me, but he showed us that he wouldn't give up. I really appreciated all the time that each of them took out to make our experience the best car buying experience we have had. I would recommend this dealership without thinking twice (I already have mentioned them to others), and I will be bringing others to come do business with Joe Bullard Cadillac in Mobile, AL.

name: Ramona Reed
text: Honestly we did not wake up that morning thinking of buying a car. We saw one on the interstate and decided to go look at them. When we got there it was freezing and windy and Darren Robinson was in the parking lot moving cars. He offered his help and we told him we were in town to Christmas shop not spend all day at a dealership, we just wanted to try the car on for size. he escorted us inside for coffee and cocoa and went to get the car. we test drove it. we loved it but we were not there to spend all day at the dealership. we left our personal information to be reviewed and were going to shop when Darren notified us that we would be using the cadillac for the day via loaner form approval. we really enjoyed using the car. we Christmas shopped all day and when we returned to the dealership we had been approved for the car with our payments within dollars of request. Jon McCartney had to have been the most professional financial manager i have ever encountered. He was a real person who made us feel right at home and comfortable to speak openly. very friendly and personable. then Roosevelt Harris enters the picture. a gem. a diamond in the rough. so charismatic so joyful and helpful and accomodating. I cannot put into words how much Darren helped to familiarize us with the cue and features. he was so knowledgable of the cars systems. he was an absolute treasure. I cant say but one thing about Joe Bullards team, "you are doing something right". I got hugs from everyone when i left. i felt like i was part of a family there. I even got a text message from Darren on Christmas morning wishing us a merry Christmas. i literally spent 2 hrs tops at the dealership and received the most beautiful CHristmas gift I could have ever dreamed of. but the most inportant thing was the environment and kindness that we experienced while there. oh and my son loved the lounge with computers and coffee/cocoa which made his time there enjoyable also. we will definitely reccomend Joe Bullard Cadillac to friends and family and we will definitely be repeat customers ourselves. my only hope is that we have the privilege of having the same staff in years to come. Thank you so very much.

name: Fred King
text:
From the moment I walked in the front door, Andrew, Ben, and Ty did their best to find the perfect car for us. They were more than successful, my wife and I both have never been more satisfied with a major purchase and the reason for this was the genuine effort each member of the team at Joe Bullard put forth to ensure that we left not only as satisified customers, but as new friends.

Andrew stayed with us and walked us through the process and was a very genuine and honest regarding the steps and what was happenning and what was going to happen.

Ben was very diligent and went above and beyond to get the exact car we were looking for... the car is perfect, just what we wanted.

Ty was also great, taking time to sit and talk to us about what was happenning and to ensure us that everything was on track and going well. It was and it did. I do not remember seeing as big a smile as when I told my wife that ya'll had her car ready... Thanks

Richard made the paperwork fly by with ease... the power of a sharpie to show me where to sign... Thanks for making the experience great.

I can not say enough about my outstanding visit and purchase, when you want to go back to the dealership that sold you a car to visit with  the people who were involved in getting you a vehicle because they are now friends, I guess that is how it is always suppossed to work, I am glad that I found the place to go and to send my friends and family to when we need not only a new vehicle, but to meet some outstanding people as well.

Thanks again!

Fred & Diane

text: Car Mart is a very professional car dealership! Lyshondia Dean is patient, courteous, polite, professional, and knowledgeable in her job! I’m very happy & pleased!

resp.text: Tee, thank you for your review! We are so happy that you are excited about buying your vehicle at our Car-Mart of Montgomery. Customer service is a top priority for us, and these reviews help us know how we’re doing. We look forward to you being a life-long customer.

name: Emily Smoak
text:
After being at two different car mart locations in the last two days, Miss Julie and Mr Bill was awesome. They helped me get into a nice ride with no problems. Super nice people and environment. They made a lifetime customer out of me.

I went to the car mart in Prattville yesterday and Justin helped me. The two cars that he recommended to me that was in my price range, I really didn’t care for. The first one wouldn’t start and the second car had oil coming out of the exhaust. He was unprofessional and I will never go to that one again. He tried to sell me 2 lemons and wouldn’t work with my finances.

Thumbs up to Miss Julie and Mr. Bill! They made a customer for life. Super customer service and helped me with my finances.

name: Charles Heard
text:
June 9, 2019

To Whom It May Concern:
I am writing to your company about a problem with my 2006 Jeep Laredo, in which I am
currently making payments. I began to have trouble with the vehicle in February, and spoke to
the manager to resolve this issue, with no solution. The thermostat was changed due to the
temperature rising on the gauge. While the Jeep is 200 miles over the warranted mileage
agreement, I believe that this occurred at such a suspicious time frame due to the expiration of
my warranty agreement. I am asking that your company cover the cost of the required repair (s).
How am I expected to make monthly payments on a vehicle that I’ve only driven for eight
months, and expected to incur no less than four thousand dollars ($4000) in expenses to repair.
Unfortunately, after having the vehicle inspected, it was confirmed that the engine needs to be
replaced, along with the replacement of the starter. Not to mention my timely payments or
referrals of at least five new customers has not been considered as me being a loyal customer.
I look forward to your reply and a resolution to my problem and will wait to hear from you at
your earliest convenience.
Respectfully noted,
Charles

resp.text: Charles Heard, Thank you so much for bringing this to our attention. We understand your frustration. We take all comments seriously. We have escalated your experience to a member of our operations management team. Someone will reach out to you soon. We sincerely value your business.

name: Sparks TheWriter
text: Let me share my experience with you both pros and cons. In September 25th I went in to car mart to purchase a vehicle. The salesman “Monica” greeted me and gave me a seat. Monica or Monic. then left me with paperwork to fill out and other reps came in and out of the office to conduct the sale. I arrived about 11 or noon. Finally a manager Darrell I think his name was, came into the office and offered a sales pitch that required several ballon payments throughout the term of contract three of those to be set as the first three payments of $575 after that payments would go to $318 for two months then another balloon payment of over $900 another set for next year for $700. But in between the mom you would be $318. I was okay with those and paid the first two actually before due date. The problem came when the check engine light didn’t go off I took it back and talked to Tim. He advised me that I didn’t have a warranty package plan (something extra you have to pay) but that he would get it into the shop and fix the issue. I drop the truck off about a week after I had it and about the 4th day he said I could come and pick it up. I was given paperwork showing that the 0-2 sensor was out and charged $400 something for repairs but would not have to pay it all at once that another side note of about $30 per month could be added. I drove home thinking the repair was completed. But the check engine light never went off so I called back to car mart and expressed this issue to them. I was told by Tim to take the truck to get another diagnostic test. Upon arrival the diagnosis was shown that the 0-2 sensor was NOT fixed. I asked the guy if he was sure because car mart charged me $400 to fix. He said yes the 0-2 sensor is not fixed. I called back to car mart Tim said he would get the truck back to the shop to fix. So I paid the $575 plus $30 repair side note thinking they would fix, but that never happened. Today is Christmas Eve and still have not gotten it fixed they keep saying they will get it back to the shop but that has not happened. I received several calls about the non payment of the repair side note because I stop paying that side note after I realized they weren’t going to fix it. All of the brakes went out and so did the two back rotors and one caliber. (The brake light was also on when I bought it) I understand that it won’t be perfect it’s used. The truck also recently stopped going in reverse or any gear for that matter it is stuck in my yard. At this point I’m over shoving money into it and dealing with the lies. I’m just going to give it back to them and find a cash paid car. Very dissatisfied and disappointed.

resp.text: Sparks, Customer service is a top priority for us, and these reviews help us know how we're doing.  Thank you for your business!

name: Darlena Shaw
text: Mr. Darell and Ms. Rhonda were always excellent. I loved the people there; honest, caring, and always there to help if you needed it. However, I guess there were some rearranging with staff. I had a terrible multiple fracture to my foot putting me on bed rest for weeks. Whom ever is in control of my account now, Brianna, was unsympathetic. She honestly asked me why I didn’t call her when I was in surgery?!? I explained that on top of making my arrangements for my son and work, I did not think about calling about my payment which I typically make at Walmart. I explained to her I would like to make the payment, however physically I can not get to Walmart. I even offered to give her my doctor’s information and email my medical release. Long story short, after she interrogated me with very personal questions I felt uncomfortable answering. she tells me to send my ex husband with the payment?!? It was surreal. I understand I have a payment owed. So, now I am dragging my broken foot to get to Walmart on crutches. I’m not suppose to drive as it’s my right foot, hence what you drive with. However, I have no other option but to risk my health to make a 160$ payment to keep my car. Be cautious if you have an emergency or if you are the sole-bread winner for your family.

resp.text: Darlena, Thank you so much for bringing this to our attention. We understand your frustration. We take all comments seriously and we want each of our customers to have a great experience. name: Chadwick Young
text:
Still paying for a car here but once I'm done I'm no longer doing any business with them. I had to pay over 300 dollars replacing calipers that shouldn't of passed their inspection before it was sold to begin with. 50 dollars of which was to put a tire back on that the tow guy offered to do shortly after I started and I was never told there would be a charge. If I was told I wouldn't of agreed to 50 dollars just to put a tire on. Because they "don't cover tires and brakes" I was left with the bill.

Few months down the road I had a blowout on the tire that the caliper was replaced. Their technician stripped a lug nut so bad that it couldn't be taken off by normal means. I had to have my car towed and the lug nut had to be taken off with a blow torch.  Another $200.00 out of my pocket because of them.  Not to mention that the mechanic who took the flat off told me that the calipers that are on it look as old as the car does, so I'm left wondering what happened to the new calipers that I paid for.

Most of the people there are nice, which I greatly appreciate. However, the rudeness and abrasiveness of the new GM, the issue with my calipers and how it was handled, then having to pay to get towed and a flat took off because of their technicians ignorance,  this vehicle will be my first and last business transaction with them. I wouldn't recommend this company to anyone with how I've been done and treated.

Your incident is not a typical experience and we would like to learn more about your situation. Please call us at 866-819-9944 so we can learn more about your incident and we can engage our operations management team to work with you toward finding a resolution.

name: Sarge off-roading
text: I have to said the credit union is a great credit union to be with. Low rates and services. But, I have one problem with the 800 number you can. Ever time I call. No one answers the phone and I leave my number and I don't get a call back half the time.

resp.text:
Our Member Contact Center wants to follow up to be sure we don't miss any other calls and would appreciate your help. Will you send an email to Service@NavigatorCU.org and include the phone number(s) you use when calling our 800-344-3281 number?

We really appreciate the positive review, and we also appreciate your feedback about your experience with our Member Contact Center. While it is true we've been experiencing extremely high call volumes, you should receive a call back as soon as possible after leaving your number. We apologize. Thanks so much for being a Navigator Member!

name: Ryan Hall
text: I really only opened my account here for an auto loan. After it was paid off, I've kept the account opened just to use as a small savings account. I may not come in often, but I have never had any problems. Everybody in there is always really helpful and nice.

resp.text: Thanks so much, Ryan! Navigator offers comprehensive banking services, and we're here to help in any way we can. Our Save'N Up debit card savings program is especially popular, as it gives Members the chance to save, earn high interest and receive matching funds up to $300 per year. Of course, terms and conditions apply, but it's very easy to add to our free checking account. Give us a call, visit navigatorcu.org or come by any Branch to learn more. :)

name: Brian M
text: Do not use this bank. They are the worst ever! Used them for my dads estate during probate, and cashed a check that the lady at the branch gave me to use after I was physically in their office. Needless the say even though the funds were in the bank, my loan and probate check bounced because their staff is incompetent.

resp.text: We regret you feel this way following your experience with Navigator and would welcome the opportunity to follow up. Please consider sending an email to service@navigatorcu.org so we can look into this further.

name: D Dizzel
text: The new branch manager is the worst.

resp.text: We deeply regret your experience rated as one-star; Member satisfaction is a top priority. Would you be willing to provide additional details to us at Service@navigatorcu.org? We'd like to follow up and ensure your future interactions with the Navigator Team are much more to your satisfaction.

text: Really had a bad experience with these guys. For Julio to have such a great name in our area to have bad management working for him really took me by surprise. Had a deal on a car we agree on the price told the manager that we would be there first thing in the morning to pick the car up. Even offered to pay for it over the phone. Got a text at 9 pm that they had sold it for more money without even giving me a option to match the price. Just really bad customer service and won’t recommend dealing with them.

I apologize that I do not recall the gentleman in Sales who I spoke to briefly, very sympathetic to my situation; to the Service manager Matt, who advised he would allow my vehicle to remain on lot until picked up; to John who shuttled me to a car rental to leave town. Everyone, at every encounter, went above and beyond to make my experience as pleasant as possible; they were honest, upfront and exhibited complete trustworthiness, which was very refreshing to experience. Thank you all and keep up the great customer care! It really makes all the difference.

name: Tabitha Payne
text:
I met Matthew Moss while looking at the Mazda 6’s. He introduced himself and asked some questions about my needs in a car. He pointed out the safety features, the roominess of the car, the amazing gas mileage and other features found in the Mazda 6.
Matthew introduced me to Rick Cantrell. They were both extremely knowledgeable and in no way were “pushy” or made me feel the importance of buying a car that day. I felt a sense of trust in talking with both of them.
I went home did my research and emailed Rick to send me a final cost breakdown. I was extremely happy with it and told him that I’d be there after work to pick it up.
When I arrived, it had been cleaned and the gas tank was full! I drove off in the first new car that I’d purchased in over 20 years. I absolutely love my new car and would recommend Matthew and Rick to anyone who asks me about my car.

name: JauWana Dansby
text: Thanks for your help and hardwork. Desmond Windham... I will be tell more people about you guys.

resp.text: Our reputation is one of our top priorities. Your positive review is what we are always striving for!

name: Christopher (Chris) Gill
text:
If I had just dealt with the service department it would be a five star rating. The young lady that helped me with my service was friendly, professional, and was on top of the process the whole way!

They lose a star because the parts department left a lot to be desired. It was next to impossible to get them on the phone and after a while the system sends you to a voicemail that no one apparently ever checks. I left 8 or 9 messages and never got a call back. My part had been there for three days before I found out from someone in service (when I called) that it had arrived. They either need more people in parts to handle the load or better training.

resp.text: Hi Christopher, thank you for taking the time to provide us with your feedback. We are happy that you enjoyed your experience with us - but do want to apologize for the negative experience you had with our Parts department. This is not acceptable and it will be looked into and addressed immediately. We appreciate your business and hope to work with you again soon. Take care.

name: Smita S
text: I was driving through Tuscaloosa on the way home, and the knocking sound in my car was driving me crazy. I’d just gotten my car looked at in my hometown and told nothing was wrong, but that just didn’t seem right. I called to make an appointment at Julio’s. They saw me immediately, found the problem within minutes (loose lug nuts), explained what must have happened, where it was, and fixed it + washed my car as part of their complimentary services. Lol got a tour of the place while I was waiting, too. Never been treated that nicely at a Mazda dealership in the 5 years I’ve been going to them in three different states.

The people there were very welcoming and friendly. Everyone that crossed my path greeted me with a smile and a hello, even the employee that came through the door that was just passing through while I was watching TV.

Thank you Julio Jones Mazda. I don't know when, but I will definitely be back.

name: Suzanne Henson
text: Prior to Friday, July 3, I would have given a 5 star rating to this dealership. However, on July 3, I found myself on the side of Hwy 82 for 3 hours with the oil light on, despite having the vehicle in for the 8,000 mile servicing the day prior. I was told Monday, July 6 the vehicle was 1 quart low on oil and the technician had been fired. The previous Friday I was told the technician had a long history of no problems. While the dealership manager listened and offered a complimentary service, I doubt anything I was told. I will be attempting to trade the vehicle soon.

text: Great service and great people! Would highly recommend this place to anybody! Got in and out in a hurry.

name: Trina Busby
text: I had been looking at Lexus and BMW for my new car purchase when I saw the new Mazda commercial and decided to check them out.  I was amazed that the number of amenities combined with the price blew the other brands away, and I left in a new CX-5!  My salesman Todd Hebert was so knowledgeable and enthusiastic that it made my car-buying experience easy!  The quality and affordability of the Mazda makes me recommend it to anyone looking for a new car!  From my salesman Todd to the sales manager Larry Taylor to the finance person James Otieno, the service at Julio Jones Mazda is amazing.  If you’re looking for a new car, I highly recommend Todd Hebert and the whole Mazda team.

name: Samantha Ray
text: I guess they are too busy to sell a car. I called early one day and never got a call back. Called again the next day and they were rude but took my number again. Still never heard back from them. It's probably best, I found the exact same vehicle with less miles for way less money in Birmingham.

resp.text: Hi Samantha, thank you for bringing this to our attention. Our goal is for everyone to only have positive experiences with us and so we apologize that you had a negative experience. We tried to see if we had any records of you in our system and we could not find you with your name, if there is anything more that we can do to address your concerns please send me an email to wecare@buyfromjulio.com. Thank you, take care!

name: Robert Jones
text:

text: I arrived early for my appointment and they took my car right in. The waiting room was clean and pleasant. The service manager was helpful and attentive. He asked me what services I wanted for my car in addition to the airbag recall repair. A friendly, young salesman sat to chat with me for a few minutes as I waited. Jared asked about my Mazda and my experience with the dealership. He was genuinely interested and enthusiastic about working for Julio Jones Mazda. I learned that Tuesday’s are “Ladies Day” which meant 15% off oil changes AND free massages by a therapist from Nancy Taylor Day Spa!!! I have NEVER had such a pleasant car service experience. My car had the airbag repair, an oil change, tire rotation, 17 point inspection, and the headlight “glaucoma” polished in just over an hour. When this dealership was owned by Verta Barr, it had the reputation as the best service department in town. I think that under Julio Jones’ ownership, it will regain that reputation.

name: Dylan Davies
text:
What can I say? My husband and I went to look at the Mazda CX-5. We found one online, previously, and wanted to drive one before we drove all that way to Birmingham to see it. They made us a proposal, "If we  can cut you a deal on a new one, can we have your business?" Well, of course if the price is right then, yes. We drive a grey CX-5, everything is great, but they are calling this car "new" and it has 7500 miles on it. Well, it's never been owned they say its a "demo" car. Then my husband tells them he wants to be at $19,999 financed for this car (yes, we were putting several thousand down - we didn't expect a miracle deal). They only get it down to $20,010. Then he says, well if you throw in remote start, we will take it. They came back with each of us paying half so, we decided to buy the car.

They told us that they could get us a killer interest rate of less than one percent. When we got back to financing, it was another story entirely. We ended up wit ha 4.99 interest rate because "less than one percent is only for "new" cars" well when you were trying to negotiate this deal you said it was a new car and now that we are financing you've classified it as a "used" car.

After we left, we began driving to my dad's house which is probably 100 miles away. The check engine light came on before we got there. We had O'Reily's check the computer and they said it was low oil pressure. We called and they has us call the Mazda tow truck to come pick it up and take it to the nearest Mazda which was in Birmingham. (They told me to get a rental during this time and they would pay me back.) They called for me to come pick it up three or four days later saying it was a computer problem and it was fixed. When we got there, 4 error messages were popping up on the dash. We left the car and called the sales manager at Julio Jones Mazda who never called us back and said he never got our message.

I went in to talk to the Julio Jones Mazda sales manager about this problem on Monday. They had me sit there for a while and eventually said they spoke with the technician at the Birmingham Mazda and they said I must have taken my foot off the brake too early and it caused the car to throw up those error messages. So, they blamed me for the problem.

Later, the technician from Birmingham called us personally and said they had screwed up and not fixed it properly to begin with. So, the sales manager at Julio Jones Mazda was either misinformed or blatantly lied to make me think it was my fault.

Well, we finally got the car back and it has been running fine. No more issues. However, they still haven't paid me back for the rental and it's been almost a month. I called about this and they said they lost my receipt and asked me for the amount again. I still haven't been paid and they haven't bothered to call me back. That was a week ago.

Simultaneously, I took the car in to the Julio Jones service center to get the remote start put in on a Thursday. They told me it would take a day, maybe two, to get this done. The service center is telling me that I owe our half of the remote start that was supposed to be included in the deal. Obviously, they didn't include it in the price like they said they would. Also, they had to give me a rental car because they couldn't get the remote start to work. It's now Monday and I have no clue when I am going to get my car back. I called today and they said they still couldn't get the remote start to work.

Needless to say, I don't wish this headache on anyone and I wouldn't recommend this dealership to anyone. It has been an absolute nightmare since we signed for this vehicle.

resp.text: Hi Dylan, thank you for your feedback. We sincerely apologize for your experience, as we strive to provide all of our guests with 5 star service. We understand that our management team has worked with you on this matter and has provided you with a reimbursement check for your rental charges. If there is anything further that we may do to assist you, or if there is any further feedback that you would like to provide, please feel free to email us at WeCare@BuyFromJulio.com. Thank you

text: I personally was excited about purchasing a vehicle from this car lot in the beginning  . I had my car for only 3 weeks before I started having difficulties. I returned my vehicle to the lot and paid my $75 fee that is due whenever you have a mechanical issue within your first year. I then return to pick up my vehicle after waiting three days for it to get fixed. It is now a week later and my car will not crank and I paid to get it towed to a car shop to only find out I have to get it fixed because my issue is not covered! Please make sure you check you car out before leaving the lot. Please drive your car as far as they will let you test drive it !I will not be purchasing another vehicle after this one is paid off .

name: Marsha Ray
text:
Bought my car in March, was told only greased parts covered under warranty, so radiator fan had to be replaced, thermostat, head temperature sensor, plus labor all out of my pocket! Of course they wanna save face an say they were sorry I was told that an would help me out on blower fan for air conditioner, Big liars!! Go to pick car up , call first ,they tell me I gotta pay 75.00 for service contract plus my car payment which just came due today ! So if you figure all this up I'm out of pocket a total of 520.00 for parts an labor I paid , plus an additional 262.00 to pick up a car I only had since March! Bob an Veronica are the ones I have dealt with! Not to mention I told Bob  I couldn't be without my car for 3 days, I guess to prove his point they kept it four days! You can never speak to him when you call! To me that shows ignorance on his part an carmarts part, there are only 8 cars in parking lot, so can't be that busy to not answer customers calling about their car ! But be one day late on payments an they dial all your phones off the hook ! I absolutely recommend Gil's, even bama auto sales before going there !!!

update!
Carmart put an air conditioner blower motor on my car ,which fixed the over heating ! that only cost me 75.00,

today i get in car to go to store an it would'nt even stear out driveway !
had a computer put on it an now apparently the power steering assist is going out  also bank 1 sensor 1 is coming up an bank 2 sensor 1 is coming up ! of course i researched this ! bank1 sensor 1 is 55.00
bank2 sensor 1 is 154.00
an if power steering assist is really going out its no telling how much it will be , one article i read said through dealership they paid 1737.00! i cant win for losing with this car !

name: Logan Brown
text:
Worst car lot I've ever been to. I traded in my Monte Carlo and was only given $700 for it plus I had to put down an extra $300 to get a vehicle. My first vehicle was a jeep grand Cherokee, I had it for 2 weeks and the steering column broke. I had to call and harass them for 3 days before they finally came and picked it up and let me get something different. I got a Ford edge and the battery warning light was came on. I informed them about the issue and was told by the sales associate to bring it back the following Monday because his words "It's not my job to replace a battery." I drove it and the dashboard lights, radio, and headlights were shutting off as I was driving down the road. It ended up breaking down and they wouldn't come pick it up. It ended up getting impounded and I had to pay the inbound lot fee and a tow truck to come hey I and take it to a mechanic for a diagnosis. The alternator and a plug for the oil pan were supposed to be replaced. I was called saying it was ready, when I arrived, the battery light was still on and i informed them and they tested the battery and said it might be a computer issue. I drove it and once again the radio, dashboard lights and headlights are turning on and off again and the dashboard warning lights lit up as well. I had the alternator tested and it wasn't replaced like they said it was. A radiator hose busted and the battery is dead. For anybody looking to buy a vehicle, go elsewhere.

Update: I got it back and it broke down again. They didn't fix all of the problems except for the alternator, but they didn't replace the plug and it leaked oil all on the brand new alternator. They picked it up and put a new alternator and fixed the plug. It broke down again in less than a week. All this time, I made my $225 payments every 2 weeks. It spent more time in the shop than in my possession and I had to make the payments on it regardless. I get a call telling me that the water pump is messed up and the engine will soon be messed up. I was told that I could either be traded into a different vehicle using the $1000 I put down or I could get that $1000 back, but the $675 that I paid out for my payments I don't get back. I've talked to the lot manager and the area manager and they're telling me that there's no way for me to get the money that I made my payments with back, only the $1000. This company is a bunch of crooks that sells vehicles that aren't worth being sold.

resp.text: Dear Logan.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention.   Please call our Customer Service Line at 866-819-9944 to discuss this more.

name: Sara Clark
text: If I could rate a 0 I definitely would. Bought a vehicle that we were told everything under the hood was replaced. After a month or so we replaced $700 worth of problems (just parts) under the hood. We went to the GM , Amy, who basically told us she can’t do anything about it and to bring the receipts in , a week goes by and we bring everything she asks in , never heard anything back about it since then. We finally think we have replaced and fixed everything wrong with the vehicle until the battery starts acting up , comes to find out the battery in the vehicle was the wrong battery for vehicle to begin with. I’ve continued to bite my tongue about this vehicle but when we continue to go to the staff they continue to tell us there’s nothing they can do knowing they put us in a terrible vehicle . The cars worth is $3,000 and we are paying more than double of that plus all the replacements we’ve had done to the vehicle . One day the vehicle is running okay and the next we are lucky it starts. We spoke to someone in Corporate and were told again there’s nothing they can do.I can understand the “as is” but when you just straight up lie to make a sell it’s ridiculous.This is probably the worst place to buy from if you do have low credit and just need a vehicle I would recommend anywhere but Car Mart. They will sell you a terrible car with a smile on their face.

name: sara Serene
text: ⭐🌟Level 6 Local Google Guide~ * UPDATE: THEY ARE NOW PAYING CUSTOMERS FOR GOOD GOOGLE REVIEWS* BEWARE OF THIS SCAMMING DEALERSHIP! The day after I purchased my Cadillac from them the check engine light came on and water poured into my closed sunroof. I immediately decided to evoke my 3 day return agreement, but the GM was "out of town" and she was the only one that could approve this. Upon her return I was told that I'd had the car almost a week and could not bring it back. I felt Trapped, had the car diagnosed and it was the sensors. Time went by and the car sounded horrible. Had to pay to have it diagnosed and it was the timing chain rattling extremely loud, the pieces that hold the timing chain in place had broken off and were in the oil and the catalytic converter was bad. Had it towed to the lot to be repaired per the repair agreement I paid for when the car was purchased. The current GM stated "my car would be ready in about a week and these engines are known to have this timing chain issue issue".  As a small business owner (at the time) caretaker for my disabled ill Mother and 5 year old I needed a vehicle but figured we have no choice since they do not offer a loaner. A week went by no car, a few weeks went by and STILL no car 4 weeks went by and NO CAR! It was extremely cold and this is our only vehicle to get to clients homes, work, moms critical dr appointments,  the store, pharmacy ect. I lost clients, Bill's fell behind and almost lost my home due to this. I begged the GM Amy to please just put me in another vehicle I didnt even care if I had to take a loss, but was told that was not an option. Finally got the car back and it ran ok at first, but the check engine light came back on about a week later. A few months go by and the timing chain noise returns and the chain breaks while we were going down the road. I had it diagnosed and towed as the vehicle service contract requires. Car Mart had my vehicle taken to one of the shops they use, ordered a used engine and had it in about 2 weeks later Once again neglected to fix the other issues with my vehicle that are listed on the service contract repair authorization form including a loud thud while placing it in gear. The day I picked up my vehicle I was in a rush to get to work (and was in jeopardy of losing my job due to transportation issues) the car was running rough and CHECK ENGINE LIGHT WAS ON! Spoke to Veronica at Car Mart she instructed me to run it by Auto Zone, have them plug it up and tell me what the read out said so I did that after work and now had a used engine with even more issues . The next day the GM Amy said that she will not honor the auto Zone diagnosis and I need to pay to have a shop tell me what's wrong with THE ENGINE THEY JUST PUT IN MY VEHICLE!  So as it stands now my last contact with the office to arrange repairs concerning this issue was a few weeks ago via telephone. I was treated extremely rude, not listened to, treated as if this is my fault and talked over by a member of the Car Mart staff. I have had to resign from a job I loved due to not being able to get the 7 miles to work and my small business is no more. My timing chain is making the bad noise again, the car shakes while driving after they put the engine in, it has a very strong odor of gas, and there is a huge thud everytime it switches gears. I cant get my extremely Ill Mother to her appointments, My Son to functions, find employment and now am suffering health issues of my own due to the stress from this vehicle. All I ever wanted was a good quality used car Americas Car Mart, but I guess that was to much for my family and I to ask of you. I am now feeling defeated and still trying to pay for a defective vehicle that was way over priced to begin with.

resp.text: Hi Sara.  Thank you so much for bringing this to our attention.  We understand your frustration.  We value your business and want to help.  Please call our customer service line at 866-819-9944 at your earliest convenience.

name: tonica cason
text: DON'T SHOP AT THIS dealership...I purchased an 06 Impala on June 16th 2017.. it came from the shop after day 2..motor ran hot and on day 3 returned the vehicle...Unfortunately I got stuck in another lemon from thier lot because my down payment was held on the first lemon and wasnt an option to be refunded...I drove a 05 Mitsubishi Galant off the lot on June 21st 2017..air conditioning blew cold until after the day 3 rule of course...and I called on July 5 asking about the so called warranty..only to find out I would have to pay out of pocket before they honored a repair...On my vacation to Daytona Fl..the battery had to be replaced..nevertheless throughout my trip back home the car fell apart....The lemon law has a time frame for bad deals like this and as of today I havent recieved my money back...I am suggesting to everyone ...go to a dealership who really checks thier vehicles out so you do not have to lose your money the way I have with this location..This will be another civil suit for Car- Mart!!!

text: I assume everything was done correctly, oil change and tire rotation. I arrived at 3:06 for my 3:00 appointment. ( I did say I would be there by 3:15 when I scheduled). It was 5:04 when I left. That was a long time to service my vehicle, especially when having an appointment.

name: Jack Norris
text:
This was honestly the best experience I have had with a dealership.
First, like most dealerships you get a warm greeting and all the pleasantries of being a potential buyer. This is where my experience usually changes. Usually after the salesperson talks to me, and I tell them my wants then start the negotiations it all changes. This did not happen at all. The sales people Adrienne and Chris were friendly and helpful. They seemed to genuinely care. The financial personal Timberley was very warm and tried to relate to my country roots. There was another lady there that helped me and got the car I wanted and worked out the financial part. I unfortunately forgot her name. She was awesome as well and got me exactly what I wanted!

Thank you all and please keep up the great work!

name: Erica Bass
text: Wonderful love the sale man. He was very helpful. Nathan Merchant a around applause to you, And thank you for help my family in these difficult times.

name: Chandra Sekar
text: Do not recommend this place. The wait time is much longer than what was communicated initially and there isn't a proper documentation of the services performed. I  was charged for a tire rotation and this wasn't check marked on the completed services sheet. The response from the service staff was "the technician has done it but doesn't know why it's not check marked as completed". Doesn't provide me confidence to believe if any of the other services was even done.

resp.text: Hi Chandra, Thank you for taking the time to voice your concerns. Please reach out to us at (205) 324-3371 to further discuss your concerns. Thank you and we hope to hear from you promptly.

name: carole strong
text: Typically I get good service from Jim Burke but not this time. They made promises they didn’t keep and the service took much longer than they initially told me. Was without a car for two days. Said they would have the part overnighted however it didn’t show up until the second day.

name: Micah Shields
text: Great service! Brian was helpful with getting my car’s routine maintenance back on track and making sure that everything in my car was functioning properly.

name: Gary Schneider
text:
Wonderful personalized service received on Saturday, May 29th.
Broke down on highway on Friday night. Spoke with A J Allen in the service department and was told if I got the car there early on Saturday they would do everything possible to get me back on the road to Texas. A J was there on Saturday morning and was able to diagnose and fix the issue. He kept me updated throughout the morning and had me back up and running by 11:00.

name: Christelle Williams
text: Thanks to the People At Jimburke and Most definitely a HUGE THANKS TO The Hyundai Manager and Team For helping me Get in my First car ❤️ You should definitely stop here before losing hope, They help any situation.

resp.text: Hi Christelle, Thanks so much for taking the time to share your feedback! We're happy to hear that you had a great experience with us at Jim Burke Hyundai and hope to see you again take care!

name: Renee Page-Nash
text:
The service staff are excellent.  I am disappointed with the suggested maintenance packages which are exorbitant.  They should just stick with the  owners manual maintenance schedule.

6/22 No one can tell me why my car is burning oil or why the oil light didn't come on when the oil was low.  This is concerning.

resp.text:
Renee,
Thank you so much for your review of Jim Burke Hyundai! We truly appreciate the feedback and hope to hear from you again.

name: Carey Culpepper
text: Very couteous and were willing to haggle.The new car clean-up dept needs a higher standard.

resp.text: Hi Carey, Thanks for sharing your experience. We hope you stop by and see us again soon.

name: Handsome K
text: It's located at the center of Birmingham city, where easy to access. They understand what the problem of your car and what to do to improve the condition regular basis. Their service reservation website is convenient keeping record.

resp.text: Hey there, thanks for the kind words! We're thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your experience with us and we hope to see you again at Jim Burke Hyundai.

name: Michelle Patterson
text: They listen and I just love their service

name: Sharon Burtnett
text:
My Husband and I bought our first Hyundai (Sonata) at Jim Burke in 2010. We are still enjoying this car and the sales experience was GREAT and we recommended them to friends and family.

In 2017 we bought a new Accent. Again everything was Great and we shared this experience as well.We returned  in 2018 ams bought an Elantra. The Elantra recently broke
down.  Out of warranty of course. We had it towed to Jim Burke  and we received a call that my car needed  an engine. The cost of $7500.00.I thought since we bought 3 new cars that maybe we could get a deal on this service.INSTEAD we were told there was a $150.00 for checking the car out. This was not diacussed when we called and dropped the car off. Nothing like being kicked while you are down. I did some research and found there have been problems with the Engines in the ElantrI am verys sossapointes with the company I thought was so HRgreat and can no longer recxpmend the company and I will also tell anyone that will losten about thisbjorrivlw expeI qill tell anyone who qill liisten about this horrible experience!

My typing is not so grear because of broken hand and arm.

resp.text: While we are thankful for your feedback, we would like to learn more about why your experience was not an exceptional one. Reach out to us at (205) 324-3371 to let us know how we can improve for your next visit.

name: Tre Zimmerman
text: Go see Brandon Montgomery! He will get you right with what you need! Thank you sir!

resp.text: Hey there, Tre, thanks for the kind words! We're thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your experience with us and we hope to see you again at Jim Burke Hyundai.

name: Jasmine Densmore
text: I recently had to replace my windshield and I am so please with the service at Jim Burke. The technician did excellent work and also changed my oil without me even asking. The service at this location is always great and I'll remain a loyal customer.

resp.text: Hello Jasmine and thank you for taking the time to share your detailed feedback! We are thrilled to hear that you have nothing but amazing things to say about our team at Jim Burke Hyundai and what we offer.

name: Robert Cato
text: great friendly service!! Jordan smith and Toni vines both worked with me through 3 visits. They both took time and patience working with me and getting me the best deal for what I had to offer.. I highly recommend both of these salesmen if you go to Jim Burke used car lot in north Birmingham. I was also checked up on and greeted by several other employees through out the visits. Overall great experience!!

name: Mary Ricks
text: Erica Holmes and Tanya Shelby made my experience at Jim Burke Hyundai best ever in my life. This was my first new car and my experience was overwhelme by the love and kindness and hard work that Shelby and Holmes put in to make it happen.

resp.text: Mary, Thank you so much for your review of Jim Burke Hyundai! We truly appreciate the feedback and hope to hear from you again.

name: Kleindienst Adams
text: Erica Holmes and the entire Jim Burke car purchasing experience was outstanding.  I will definitely be back

resp.text: Hey Kleindienst, thanks for the kind words! We're thrilled to hear how much you enjoyed your experience with us and we hope to see you again at Jim Burke Hyundai.

name: Janita Armstrong
text: Always get things in writing with Jim Burke..turnover rate is ridiculous. You never know who you are speaking with. Sales person and manager who made "Promises of detailing my vehicle when purchased and reimbursement to the hyundai customer who recommended me, were all lies..when I called to follow up there were no longer there. The new manager had no clue and lied to me as well. I called to follow up..he was no longer there. Poor service, inaccurate quotes, and nothing but lip service given (telling me what they thought I needed to hear).

resp.text: Thank you, Janita, for taking the time to voice your concerns. Please reach out to us at (877) 796-4559 to further discuss your concerns. Thank you and we hope to hear from you promptly.

name: Hilda Henderson
text: Our experience with Jim Burke Hyundai was a very positive and pleasant one. Our sales representative, Larry Greenhill, went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied with our purchase. His efforts were not in vain. I am very pleased with my 2020 Tucson Sport.

name: Frankie Washington
text: The whole team was wonderful but special mention for my salesman Antonio Gillespie and the Finance manager Melvin. Speedy and professional service with a smile and no games. Everyone was so friendly!! Got a wonderful deal and reasonable monthly payments!!! I recommend them highly!!!

name: Sandy Stern
text: Time expected to be finished was what they told me. Unfortunately,they could not complete all the repairs today. I really think that they needed to wait until they could repair all things at the same time.

name: PATRICK HASSELL
text: Good people GREAT product!

resp.text:
Patrick,
Thank you for reviewing your service experience! We aim to provide time-efficient and exceptional service for our guests, and we are proud that this was received during your time spent with us.

name: Essie Johnson
text: I can honestly say my experience was great! My salesman, Dennis Johnson was absolutely AMAZING! He is very knowledgeable, courteous,  attentive, patient, honest. If you are looking for a car without all the hassle, Jim Burke Hyundai is where you want go. The staff is great.  Great deals, great cars, great people!  They really care!  I am a customer for life!

name: Alexus Carter
text: I had a great experience at this dealership, everyone was really friendly and willing to help. The best thing was I drove away in a new car! Big thanks to everyone who helped! I definitely recommend!

name: Paul Berman
text: Jordan Cook continuously goes out of his way to ensure that my service visits are done quickly, in the most cost efficient manner.   Servicing my car can be a challenge as I am currently traveling outside of AL weeks at a time.  Whenever its time for the vehicle's next servicing, help is only a p[hone call away.  Jordan demonstrates unwavering attention to details and customer service, which is why I bring my 2016 Hyundai Sonata Sport to Jordan in Birmingham versus having it serviced in Atlanta or other possible locations.  Why?  Because in my opinion, he cares about his customers and their satisfaction with Jim Burke's service and his own professional service as well.  Thank you Jordan for all you do!

name: Angela Brown
text: I purchased a new Sonata and everyone at Jim Burke was so helpful & nice. My salesperson Alexis was so knowledgeably and was not pushy at all. The General Manager Tanya worked really hard on getting me approved for the vehicle and was very detailed and explained everything to me and kept me informed through the whole process

name: josette rice
text: Always outstanding service!  Jordan and everyone on the service  team is always very helpful and believe in making sure you're a satisfied customer!

resp.text: Thank you, Josette for this wonderful review of Jim Burke Hyundai. Jordan and the rest of our fantastic team here pride themselves on making every visit with an exceptional one. We look forward to seeing you again soon. Have a nice day!

name: Melissa Mynatt
text: The service center was excellent. From the time i got there until I had left the customer service was one of the best i had visited to date.  The only complaint i had was grease was left on my driver seat and on the driver door liner.  I wished the mechanic had paid as much attention as the service center or possibly protected the seat.

name: Bryanna McClain
text: The associates at Jim Burke Hyundai all were welcoming and kind. In particular I would like to acknowledge my dealer Andrew Briggins who made sure I was comfortable and that I got what I wanted. He was very thorough and very knowledgeable about the inventory at hand and unknowingly persuasive when introducing me to the 2020 Hyundai Sonata SEL. I absolutely love my car and I am proud of my choice. Thank you Andrew and Jim Burke Hyundai for my sweet sweet ride!

name: Susan Crow
text: I have had a great experience with Eddie Hicks as my service advisor.  I always feel like I am being dealt with honestly.

resp.text: Susan, we are glad to hear you had a positive experience working with Eddie.  Our team prides themself on providing an honest and easy approach to helping our customers with all of their automotive needs.

name: Bama Born & Bred
text: I went to Jim Burke Hyundai recently and received excellent service. The service technician was very nice and polite. He advised me of a recall that was on my car and explained what it was for and how they would fix it.  I got three services for my car(which included the recall) and was out in 1 hour. I didn’t even have an appointment!!! The customer waiting area was comfortable and check out was easy and quick.  I would highly recommend the service department to anyone needing great work on their automobile and good customer service.

name: Jon Tanja
text: I was satisfied

name: Ayesha Aj
text: Jessie was the best car salesman I have ever encountered. Adrienne was not my salesperson but she was very hospitable, friendly and thorough! I would definitely recommend either of them to anyone needing a vehicle !!

name: Tae Alexander
text: Purchased a 2020 Hyundai Santa Fe’ through Brandon Blagg. He was excellent from the beginning to the end. He made the process easy. He explained and demonstrated things to us in a way that most others might have not. Although the sale was important, to him he showed just as much concern about driving away in something that we wouldn’t regret. The atmosphere was nice and welcoming. Not boring at all. The staff was friendly too.  In the end Brandon wouldn’t stop until the last tire received its shine. Thanks a bunch!

name: Monica Leach
text: I am enjoying my little gas saver.

resp.text: Monica, we hope we can turn these 3 stars into 5. We want to hear from you—please give us a call when you can at (877) 796-4559. Thanks!

name: Brittany Card
text: Took my car in for a check engine light that was on for a month. The light was off by the time I took it in of course but Jim Burke found the problem and fixed it. Location is so close and convenient to my job so made it easy to drop off and pick up. Will definitely be going to them again for any service for my car! They were fantastic!

name: Dayatra Laster
text: Service writer recommended I get a transmission flush on 2/17/20. I had a transmission flush done on 1/27/20. Same auto shop same service writer.

name: Jillian Carter
text: I had a really awesome experience at Jim Burke Hyundai. I was referred by a close friend of the family to go in visit Alexis and Tanya. These ladies lets my family and I  know that they had our best interest at heart.The service was quick and smooth. I truly thank Jim Burke and staff for our 2019 Elantra Value.

name: Alexis Morton
text:
I had a very wonderful experience at the  Hyundai service department.  Eddie Hicks, the service representative was very knowledgeable and helpful during my visit. Questions were answered without hesitation and he didn’t try to rush me off. Eddie was also helpful getting me an Uber to my friends house . After getting to my friends house and getting a bite to eat my car was ready to be picked up. Fast service. Thanks again for taking care of my car. I will be back for an oil change in a few months.
Alexis Morton

name: Beth Cooper
text: The staff were wonderful and extremely professional.  They updated me when needed, took time to explain the automotive issue and the repair used to update the vehicle. Another impressive detail I noted was the multiple transporters who checked to see if the customers had a need for transportation.  I’ve been highly impressed by the service provided and I will definitely return .

name: LUIS FELIPE ORTIZ ALMODOVAR
text: My experience from the start was very respectful treatment from all the team at Jim Burke specially from Clearance thanks to all you guys and for the cups of coffee during the deal thanks to be so kind with me even when my English it was not perfect you deal with and gave me a good attention to all my request God Bless You All Guys and thank you Kendra for your help and beautiful Smile all the time

name: Andrew Gordineer
text: Even though I didn't get my car there, they were very accommodating.

resp.text: Andrew, We're grateful to know that your experience with us was an amazing one! We look forward to seeing you again soon at Jim Burke Hyundai.

name: Holly Davis
text: Completely satisfied!  I would 100% buy another car from Jim Burke.  Their selection is great and the Sales and Finance teams were excellent to work with.  They were understanding and able to work with our situation and got us exactly what we wanted.

name: Berdell White
text: I was very pleased with the service that I received from everyone at Jim Burke's All my questions were answered promptly!  I'm enjoying my new 2020 Hyundai Palisade! I love it!

name: Peter Newman
text: Good workmanship but the place is rather crowded and hectic.  They need more space and the ability to put fine touches like cleaning to a job after completion considering the quotes are a bit pricey.

name: Sandra D Kindell
text:
The service associates are always professional and courteous.  They advise on service needed to your car, giving details of the service and the expected cost. The cost factor is important, because  quite frankly, money doesn't grow on trees.  They  also give you an estimation on the length of time involved in completing the setvice.  Most of them remember you if you have had repeat business with Jim Burke.

The cashier at the Hyundai service area is always very friendly and helpful.  She is an asset to the department.

name: mycal garrett
text: I just purchased a car from Hyundai and i had the best experience I've had in a long time. My sales rep was Ashley and she is a very polite and respectful salesman. She helped me with everything that i needed and then some. Very knowledgeable about the product and very informative as well. Probably one of the best sales reps I've had the pleasure of dealing with. If you are interested in buying a Hyundai from Jim Burke. Ask for Ashley she wont disappoint.

name: Sherry Lacey
text: Chris Thomas and the finance manager were great! I know God sent them to me. They are the best! Thank you!

name: Steven Gross
text: My experience with Jim Burke Body Shop was a pleasant one - from the initial phone call, through the claim/repair process, and finally to pick-up. At the front desk, Ashley handled my reception with the utmost courtesy and customer service. Josh, the assistant manager was equally professional and the one who handled my claim and kept me up to date on the status and dealt with the insurance company on my behalf. Finally, on pick-up, I found my car waiting for me, freshly cleaned - inside and out. The body shop is a Hyundai preferred repair center and I would recommend them to my fellow Hyundai drivers.

name: Myra Reed
text: I was thrilled with the short wait time. I always ask for Eddie and once again he provided superior customer service. As an example, it was raining and he pulled my car inside so I wouldn’t get wet when leaving. Super great guy!!

name: Bobbie Cagle
text: Always quick and on time.  Always friendly and helpful!

name: dorothy thomas
text: Jim Burke Hyundai is a great place to get a car Tony take his n da rest of the team to I love I would have them ten stars

name: JOEL BUCKLEY
text: Very courteous service writers. Quick turn around on repairs. Mechanics are great! Wouldn’t take my Hyundai anywhere else!

name: sandra richard
text:
Eddie Hicks is very nice and very up to date on the details of our Hyundai. Has been very helpful during recalls.
Also pleasant and friendly when car needs serviced.

name: S G
text: Great customer service. Excellent and fast service. Would recommend to everyone. They made us feel extremely confortable. The waiting room and restrooms were in excellent condition. Awesome awesome awesome job guys.

name: luvsnow83
text: I had an awesome experience and appreciate the whole team! Thanks a lot everyone ❤️

name: Vicki Colburn
text: Me and my husband purchased a 2019 Hyundai Kona a few weeks ago and we are very pleased with the help of our salesman Dennis Johnson, and all the staff they really went above and beyond just a salesperson.. we won’t go anywhere else when we get ready to buy again we will definitely be back

name: Charles Chancellor
text: I have been doing business with this dealership for over twenty five years. The Hyundai dealership at Jim Burke is the best when it comes to respect, courtesy  and understanding the customers need and successfully meeting them. Great people and great to do business with.

name: BLAMS 4Life
text: A professional and thorough experience.   They worked wonderfully with my insurance company and repaired my car back to like new status.  Great job

name: christopher kendrick
text: It’s was fast and easy and that’s not something I’m use to with car buying. The sales rep Kera took her time to make sure I was not just getting a car I liked but also a car i could truly afford. Jim Burke has earned me as a forever customer!

name: Bella Divine
text: I am always impressed with this dealership. The quality of service is unmatched by other shops or dealers. They are always friendly, professional and they value my time. I would happily recommend them to anyone.

name: Ally Trigg
text: Love their innovative interface with texting and choosing what is and is not done as well as status of your vehicle. Amazing communication.

name: Miranda Cantlow
text: I like to say that everyone at Jim Burke Hyundai was so caring and helpful I would recommend friends and family to come and purchased a car. And my sales person Brandon Blagg was so helpful to me and explained all the details. Everyone was so nice. Thanks so much. Mrs. Miranda Cantlow

name: Patricia Carden
text: Eddie was very helpful. Explained all work that was done and work that needs to be done.  He was friendly and courteous. Will definitely recommend him and Jim Burke.

name: Andrea Thames
text: The service guys are always to attentive and personable!  They are always so nice!!!

name: sylviash2
text: Jim Burke is by far the best Hyundai dealer in Birmingham  they found problems that the other dealers could not find. One thing I was a little disappointed in though was not detecting a massive hole in my air intake on the first visit, which seems like it should have been easily detected it was only discovered when I brought the car back the next day because it still wasn’t running right  but they went out of their way to helpful our service writer Eddie Hicks was a class act and seemed like he genuinely cared

name: Miranda Cantlow
text: I like to say that everyone at Jim Burke Hyundai was so caring and helpful I would recommend friends and family to come and purchased a car. And my sales person Brandon Blagg was so helpful to me and explained all the details. Everyone was so nice. Thanks so much. Mrs. Miranda Cantlow

name: Andrea Thames
text: The service guys are always to attentive and personable!  They are always so nice!!!

name: Karen Hanson
text: My service representative is very friendly and helpful. The work on my car was done quickly. They are good about getting me in and out in a timely manner. I wish the location was closer to me but I like this service department.

name: Connie McCreless
text: Had a really good experience.  My sales rep Brian Christopher was very helpful without being pushy.  He listened to what I wanted and did everything to make sure I was satisfied.  The entire experience was very pleasant.  After the sale was completed he sat in the car with me to go over everything and told me if I had any questions to give him a call and he would be more than happy to help.  By the time I left I thought of him as a friend and not just a sales rep.  I was very impressed with the lease experience.  Had never done this before but it was not at all scary or stressful.  I have always had a high opinion of the dealership and this has confirmed my opinion.  Love the car and expect to be doing business with this rep and dealership for a long time.

name: adam jaffe
text: Brian Christopher is absolutely fantastic to deal with.  His outstanding attitude and extensive knowledge of the vehicles makes every car buying experience a great one.  Brian goes above and beyond making every buyer feel comfortable and at ease with their purchase from Jim Burke.   Brian always returns calls in a prompt manner and no question is too small to answer.  Once again thank you Brian I love my purchases.

name: Paula Johnson
text: It's always a pleasure to go to Jim Burke service center. My advisor Jordon is like family. I know everyone there. We always enjoy seeing each other. I will continue to take my Hyundai to my favorite place!

name: mark Myszka
text: Jim Burke makes car buying easy. I told them which car I wanted. They showed me the options available and I made my choice. I wanted a red one they didn't have it in stock so they went and got it for me. Financing was a snap with their help. This was the second car I purchased at Jim Burke and next time I need a car I will go back.

name: Patricia Carden
text: Eddie was very helpful. Explained all work that was done and work that needs to be done.  He was friendly and courteous. Will definitely recommend him and Jim Burke.

name: Patricia Russo
text: We were on the way to Louisville, Ky. from New Orleans. We got off the interstate in Birmingham to fuel up.  By the way, we went 360 miles on one tank of gas in my Tucson. Anyway, riding around looking for a station, a huge piece of metal pierced my right rear tire. No way we could ride all the rest of the way on the spare. I knew I wanted a Hyundai dealer to replace the tire.We found a gas station, then found this dealer right around the corner! The service department was incredibly nice and squeezed us into their busy day.  We were back on the road in no time! Thankyou, Thankyou, Thankyou, Jim Burke Hyundai! I love my local Hyundai dealer (shout out to Hyundai of Metairie!) but this one is fabulous too!!!

name: Suzanne Helmick
text: Once again I am extremely pleased with the service provided by Jim Burke Hyundai.  The service rep, AJ, explains just exactly what they will say do.  Love having my Tucson serviced here.

name: Taylor Woods
text: Great experience all around. From the sales dept to the service dept, Jim Burke’s staff provided top notch  customer service and honesty I’ve never found in a car buying experience before. Thank you guys!

Great staff

Thanks for the advise and the wonderful experience I received!🤗
