text: The service representative at Jim Burke Hyundai was very pleasant, efficient, and helpful.  All issues were solved in a professional manner and I would recommend them to anyone who needs Hyundai service.  High five for Hyundai!

name: Jocelyn Nelson
text: Vedo was very knowledgeable and went above and beyond to make my very 1st car buying process smooth, painless and easy.

name: Gloria Franklin
text: We just bought a Santa Fe Sport. My husband and I dreaded buying a car. We have had a few experiences that were anything but pleasant. But this time was different. We worked with Billy Kimbrell and it was the best experience ever. He was patient, knowledgeable and just a nice guy. The entire staff made us feel at ease. They definitely did a great job. I highly recommend  Billy and the Jim Burke crew.

name: Michael Huff
text: Great service as always.  Never disappointed!

name: Mandisa Davis
text: Great vehicle shopping experience. I was very pleased with my experience while shopping for a vehicle for my daughter.  Theo Black did the most amazing job gathering all the details to meet her needs.  No pressure and lots of information to help make the process easier.  I know that when we return to purchase her next vehicle, the experience will be just as amazing! Thank you, Theo and Jim Burke Hyundai.

name: Betsy Marks
text: Really good. Quick service. Provided rides to and from work.

name: Dashanae Milner
text: Very good community service! I drove off the lot with a brand new car the same exact day I went. Mr. Jessie was a very big help!!!! Thank you.

name: Jessica Matz
text: Fast and friendly service. Did not have my tire in stock there but was able to get it from their warehouse and have it replaced within a couple hours. Would recommend and return.

name: rebecca thompson
text: Great experience and care from the time we walked in the door until we left. Not once did I feel pressured to purchase my car, but felt comfortable with going ahead with the purchase even though I was reluctant. My daughter and I were treated with MUCH respect and care. Julius, Brandon, and Cheri were Great!!

name: Shana Thomas
text: It was quick and painless to get my new car. Thanks to Vedo Hill for working with me and I love my car!

name: letonue
text: Great place to purchase a vehicle customer service was excellent didn't require a lot of paperwork for your purchase.

name: Marissa Abrams
text: I had an amazing experience buying a new car! Josette Rice has ensured that my transition from my other car to this one has been easy and smooth. She was very helpful while I was trying out cars and continues to be helpful weeks after the purchase! Everyone else was very kind and I couldn't be happier doing business with them!

name: Sarah Rezonzew
text: Great service every time I bring my car into Jim Burke. Thank you!

name: Melissa Canada
text: I had a great experience with a knowledgeable sfaff. I appeeciate all that they helped me accomplish. I would recommend them to all my friends

name: Teresa Latham
text: They went out of their way to be nice to me.  I really appreciated how they helped me to find where I needed to go.  The waiting room was pleasant, they provide free coffee and the only thing I could suggest is to add tea and cocoa for us weirdos that do not drink coffee although they do have vending machines for snacks and soda.

text: The service was great!!! The people was nice n friendly especially Eddie Hicks

text: My buying experience at Jim Burke Hyundai was second to none.  My sales person Brian Christopher was outstanding.  He was professional, friendly, and knowledgeable regarding the particular vehicle I bought.  I purchased a 2017 Hyundai Santa Fe Sport.  As far as financing goes Mr. Willie gets the job done.  He fights for his customers to get the most competitive rate and terms. I sincerely appreciate everything both of these gentleman did to make my buying experience a truly pleasant one!

name: Bill Pautler
text: Always courteous and do a good job

resp.text: Hello Bill! We're grateful to know that your experience with us was an amazing one! We're always happy to hear appreciation from our customers. We look forward to seeing you again soon at Jim Burke Hyundai.

text:
As a luxury car owner and was promised priority and the best attention but i was there and nothing priority

name: Tebriel Alexander
text:
I went to test drive a Hyundai Santa Fe'  two days ago. This is not my first Hyundai since reinventing itself and blowing our minds. Needless to say I purchased what is now my 5th Hyundai.  However, i'm here to brag on the man who walked my husband and I through this entire process in this humid Alabama weather.  Initially, I came in to take advantage of the $50 GIFT CARD that Hyundai was offering for simply test driving its vehicles, but I also knew that I would potentially be driving off the lot with something new as well. Brandon Blagg was awesome from the gate. He stood and walked over to me, invited me to his desk, and inquired concerning my business. A few questions later, a copy of my license, and "BAM" we were test driving a base model Santa Fe.' One would think that this guy designed these vehicle with his level of knowledge concerning them. Recalling that I have own several vehicles in my lifetime, it is feasible to understand that we have dealt with our share of sales consultants. This is by far the first person who not only informed us of what we would potentially enjoy about the vehicle, but patiently explained in detail its benefits, and demonstrated  to us its functionality. He took a base model vehicle and literally painted a picture that lifted it beyond it's level. He hung out with us for over an hour doing comparisons and contrasts. He was honest concerning pro and cons, but never negative.. not one time. For him every vehicle had its benefits, and for every person there was vehicle that fit them. THIS IS WHAT HE DID! He didn't interfere with our choice, but he made sure that we would be satisfied once we left  the lot for good. In the end we ended up purchasing a Santa Fe' SEL 2.4 engine with both the Convenience and Premium Package. He didn't use a hustler tactic to cause us to go for a higher grade, it was simply his transparency and patience that ultimately led to our selection. Recalling that this was in 90 + degree weather, this man didn't stop until the tires shined.  He made me laugh, shared stories, explained who was whom of the CEO vs. COO, and also wasn't shy around me whatsoever. He even blew bubble gum bubbles for our delightful 6 year old who stood amazed at the excellence his gum blowing abilities. Brandon Blagg, job well done. You deserve all that's coming for your hard work and dedication to service. Aside from our direct experience with Brandon, everyone rocked. Their pleasantness was superb, two of the women conversed with me, they offered treats to my babies, and others smiled and waved. There wasn't a rude attitude in the building. The lobby and bathrooms are well designed and clean. As lengthly a process that car buying could be, they have enough going for themselves to make you relax and enjoy your time.

Thanks Again, Tae A.

name: Agee Richardson
text: I can't say enough about the awesome staff in the Jim Burke Hyundai Service Department. Rusty, the Hyundai Service Department manager, has been very attentive to my automotive needs. When there was a way to hold the manufacturer's accountable for repairs associated with their recall, this service manager had no problem going to bat for me. Although my first impression of this establishment was not a good one due to lack of communication, my final impression is the one that REALLY COUNTS! I feel so blessed that these were the guys: Rusty, Eddie and Justin that tended to my 2013 Hyundai Sonata and me when my car just STOPPED RUNNING on the interstate. It took about a month to get my car fixed right, but they have stuck it out. I am proud to say that my blue-silver streak and I are on the road again tearing up the highway!!! Adrienne Richardson from Birmingham is your #1 Fan!!!

Also, make sure you know what your car is worth to the dime before attempting to trade. They will not give you anywhere near what your car is worth.

I test drove the vehicle on a Monday and pointed out a few cosmetic issues that I feel should have been addressed prior to placing the car up for sale (only a few hundred dollars to correct).  That combined with the manager coming outside to talk to me smoking a cigarette, should have clued me in to the professionalism and pride taken at the dealership.
I was asked that if the problems I pointed out were corrected,  would I purchase the car? I agreed.  The following day I recieved the bill of sale and I noticed that the price shown on the internet was not the price shown on the bill of sale. When I asked the manager, the explanation I recieved was that the car was headed to auction the day I saw it and the price on the internet was the auction price, not the sale price (what does that have to do with me? And the price I came intending to pay is the price that I saw advertised ).  I was then told that they would sell it to me at the internet price but I would have to pay for the repairs which would be $400+.  Since the price was still under book value,  I agreed.  I was then told that the car would be repaired, HAND WAXED and ready for me in a couple days.  I was informed Friday that the car was ready. I drove up Saturday only to find the car just as dirty as it was when I test drove it on Monday(they sprayed the dirt off but there was still hair and dirt on the inside of the car.... wheel wells were dirty, etc). Of all the cars I've bought,  no one has ever tried to delivered me a dirty car! I discussed this with the manager who appeared to care nothing about it.  I left with no intention of buying the car,  but the salesman,
Mr. Willie, called and said that he would take care of it...... he took it to a local shop and had it washed and vacuumed.  As a customer, when money is spent, whether it be $30 or $30,000, you want to feel good about spending it. That's not the feeling I left with.  In the end, I purchased what I feel is a great vehicle.   But the service is what will definitely keep me from being a repeat customer or recommending to anyone else.  Professionalism and putting the customer first is definitely lacking and needs a lot of improvement.

name: Jo Jones
text: I am completely dissatisfied with Jim Burke Suburu and will not ever bring my car there again, even if I have to drive outside Alabama. I took the car in for four recalls.  When I picked up the car the car three lights came on, the car wasn't running smoothly, and I called the technician. He said "nothing they did could have caused this."  Also he told me the diagnostic test -which I didn't want or ask for - indicated the car needed a timing belt,AC etc lot of work that's is needed at a 100,000 miles.  I told him this was already done.  I took my car to my usual mechanic who cleaned the throttle so that the new ECM would read it properly.  Your guys should have known this and should not have returned the car to me in the condition they did.  Also,the right passenger airbag light hasn't been reset.  It's still showing an error. I just hope they really replaced the defective airbag

text: I bought a 2012 Volkswagen Passat with 85,912 miles on it. This was the worst car buying experience ever. My original salesman was nice but knew nothing about a car at all. My battery had a dead cell when I first purchased it. I took it back for the battery to be replace and it took four hours to get a new battery. I asked them to take me to the service center to find out what was taking so long and the guy that work in the front said my battery has been there for two hours. And the guys that were supposed to be working were playing and joking around the next time I needed work done was three days later I noticed the bumper on the car was popped out of place, the 12 volt adapters didn't work, the service light had come on, the key tumbler was messed up in the ignition. I went to try and get that fixed and they told me it would be two days well I asked if they would give me a replacement car to get back and forth to work they told me no they don't do that. Ok so I paid for the work myself. A few days later I discovered my account was overdrawn 500 dollars and when I ask the finance manager why my account was charged and I paid 1000  in cash his response was well we wanted 1500 for the car and u couldn't do that. So they took it upon themselves to take the other 500 dollars. Now after they agreed to give my money back.  I waited a week and called and he said I could pick it up across the street so I went across the street from them and the guy over there didn't know what I was talking about so he called Cleveland Moore the guy I've been having problems with to asked him where I needed to go Cleveland didn't know that he was on speaker phone and said " she so damn stupid" he really called me stupid and then when I informed him he was on speaker phone he said so. name: Anne Murray
text:
I was treated very politely, the salesman even picked me up at my home, because my car had caught on fire and I had nothing to drive.BUT the car I was supposed to look at was no longer available. They did not tell me it had sold when I called that same morning to verify my appt. & it's still on the internet as "Available" the following day. Further more 5 days later, it's still listed on the internet as available. So NOW I'm positive it's to lure customers in. If someone is awaiting approval for financing on this vehicle, the very least Jim Burke Hyundai should do is post a flag on the car saying; "Sold Pending Approval of Financing". In my opinion, that would be " Professional Business Protocol".

I'm of the opinion that they might possibly do this to get customers to come in when it looks like a certified car is lower priced then average.

I believe they tried to do a "bait & switch" maneuver on me by showing me a same priced vehicle that was the same color but a different make and model.

The sales mgr. also told me he would find me a Pre-certified car in the same price range that same day, however he never followed through or even had the professionalism to call me back one way or the other. I called him later that afternoon, I didn't want the other car I looked at, at another dealership to get sold, & asked if he could call me back by 6pm  to tell me if he had found another car so I could make a decision. He never called.

Bottom line... before you make the trip to see a specific car, make absolutely sure it's still for sale.

name: Traci Miller
text: DO NOT PURCHASE A USED CAR FROM THIS DEALERSHIP. And if you do, please, make sure you ask them to print and show you any TSB's (Technical Service Bulletin) on the vehicle you are considering. A TSB is not like a safety recall and therefore the dealership is not required to make the repair. Make them prove to you that they have repaired all of the items on each and every TSB. However, I can almost promise you that they will not make the repairs before selling you the vehicle. I purchased a used 2007 Hyundai Entourage van from Jim Burke Hyundai's used car dealership in March this year after having purchased a new Elantra from them last year. I did not make them show me the TSB's because I wasn't aware of them at the time. Unfortunately there are several of them on the van I purchased. One of them had to do with a part that causes called the "Junction Box Switch" or Instrument Panel Module that causes the battery to discharge. That means when you go out to your car it simply won't start!! I found the TSB on it and it says in large print that it was issued to all Hyundai General Managers and that the repair should be made before retail sale of the van. Many of us believe that purchasing a used car from what you think is a reputable dealership will protect you from these type issues. Well...this dealership is not reputable and should be put out of business. I have contacted them to give them a change to try and make this right to keep customers happy and try to get return business but they obviously are not intersted in this. I will be taking further action regarding this issue.

text: I took out a loan with this company and made payments as agreed - until my bank account was hacked and emptied. At that point I stopped making payments until they could provide proof they did not sell my information. Today they took the entire amount due on the loan from my new bank account - I had not provided them with any information on that account - $600 loan balance and $1000 in 'interest'. They are crooks.

name: Cody Pfendler
text: I’d like to say I’m happy with my purchase but I can’t. I was in desperate need for a new vehicle due to mine breaking down, went to car mart and got a van. Ran great for the first week and was extremely happy. After a week, out on a family day with my whole family the van wouldn’t shut off after I took the key out. Started smoking and leaking, had to stop our family say short and pay for a tow truck and no way to get my whole family home. It went in the shop for over a week, got it back and 2 days later it does it again, won’t shut off, smoking, leaking. Also after a look at it from a mechanic I know, there’s also oil in the radiator. So basically I have a van I leased just sitting in my drive way not being used that I’m making payments on. I can’t trade it in for a different one either. Not too happy with all of this. It’s just been a headache.

resp.text: Cody, thank you so much for bringing this to our attention. We understand your frustration. We take all comments seriously. We have escalated your experience to a member of our operations management team. Someone will reach out to you soon. We sincerely value your business.

name: Gaming_epics15 _
text:
*READ IF YOURE CONSIDERING CAR-MART*

So, I got a car for 400 dollars down. Pretty cheap right? My payments were set at 135 a week for the 2 years except around tax time I had a few payments over 500 dollars. I never missed my payment and I was never late on a payment, not once. As time went on and things changed for me and my family, I couldn’t afford the car anymore. I was paying 540 dollars a month for a 2008 Honda Civic. I took the car back and told them i just couldn’t afford the car because the payment monthly was more than a house payment per month. Now even though I brought the car back and was an excellent customer with my time with car mart I get a repo on my credit for up to 7 years. Save yourself time and money and do not buy a car through car mart because at the end of the day it is a scam. They only care about money and if you get to the point where you can’t pay regardless of the situation they will stick you with a very negative credit report for the next decade.

name: Dennis W.
text: Getting a title loan needs to be your absolute last resort. Places like this should be illegal, charging over 170% APR when you’re already at your lowest point. In November 2020, I took out a $2700 title loan on my vehicle after my differential self-detonated. It was a rough time, with several other unexpected bills piling up amidst my lowered COVID-19 income. I was finally able to pay it off in April 2021, and it cost me $4,343.45 over just 5 months. That’s $1,643.45 in interest charges. If you’re someone who’s making an average wage, I can guarantee you’ll never be able to pay off a title loan. Period. Best yet, when I finally paid off my loan, they held my title for a week because of “recent fraudulent activity” surrounding the title loan industry. There’s a lot of crooked businesses out there, but title loan places rank #1 in my book.

name: ter b
text: I dealt with Terrence, superb customer service he even sat on floor and played with my 2yrs old son while we waited on the appraiser about my loan amount, I have never experience such wonderful and homely experience in my life. Loan process was easy and hassle free. Overall all the staff were friendly. That's what you call first class customer service I think this company needs to go out and train other companies how to deal with their customers.

name: Wayne White
text: I had come into the Brewton, AL office on a Friday after 5pm and spoke with a JoAnn. After speaking with her I realized that I needed to come back the next day which I did although I arrived later than I intended due to playing locksmith at home on my girlfriend's car. Anyway, lol, even though I arrived later than desired in order to make it to the bank before they closed JoAnn feverishly got everything in order for me to get to the bank with not a minute to spare. At that moment that was everything to me and it allowed me to make my payment for the electric bill before that following Monday when it would have most likely been disconnected. Things have improved drastically, financially speaking and I'm on my way to the TitleMax office and get my title back before heading down to central FL for work. I would like to give a huge thank you to JoAnn and say that as far as I'm concerned she's deserving of any and all accalades. Again thanks JoAnn and thanks TitleMax.
